entries: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this ability after completing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Dreams and Nightmares
entries: You gain the ability to manipulate the mind of mortal beings. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a Humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. The DC is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

On a failed saving throw, the creature has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition, as it is stuck in a blissful dream or a terrifying nightmare. The condition lasts for 1 minute. The target can attempt the Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage.

You can choose to concentrate on the effect as you would a spell. If you are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on the effect when the target attempts its saving throw, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Weakened Constitution
entries: Your connection to the Fey Courts has granted you tremendous power but also an inherent fragility. When you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} for the first time after you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} equal to your Transformation Stage to remove one level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} gained in this manner. You gain no other benefit from those expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Seasonally Affected
entries: Your connection to the Realm of Fey has a stronger pull on you. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as the Fey Court attempts to claim your soul as their own.

Additionally, you gain {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to a certain damage type based on the Fey Court that you are pledged to. You cannot benefit from {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage.

entries.name: Spring
entries: You are {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Summer
entries: You are {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Cold damage.

entries.name: Autumn
entries: You are {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Radiant damage.

entries.name: Winter
entries: You are {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Magic Tricks
entries: Your Fey masters provide even further magical abilities. You gain the ability to cast one level 3 spell, one level 4 spell, and one level 5 spell. You can cast each of these once without using a spell slot or needing spell components. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The DC for these spells is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

entries.name: Spring
entries: Your spells are {@spell Stinking Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Vitriolic Sphere|XPHB}, and {@spell Cloudkill|XPHB}.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Your spells are {@spell Fireball|XPHB}, {@spell Fire Shield|XPHB}, and {@spell Dream|XPHB}.

entries.name: Autumn
entries: Your spells are {@spell Lightning Bolt|XPHB}, {@spell Blight|XPHB}, and {@spell Hold Monster|XPHB}.

entries.name: Winter
entries: Your spells are {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB}, {@spell Ice Storm|XPHB}, and {@spell Cone of Cold|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Twilight Glamour
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition for 1 hour or until you end it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell that causes the target to make a saving throw, the remaining duration changes to 1 minute.
You can use this ability twice, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Soul
entries: You become a Fiend in addition to any other creature type(s) you have. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) checks.
Additionally, choose one of the following damage types and gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to it: Acid, Cold, or Fire.

optionalfeature.name: Devilish Contractor
entries: You have acquired the ability to bind mortal creatures to your will. You can create a contract to bind a mortal Humanoid's soul to you, feeding on its power. The mortal gains a gift asked for in the contract, and you gain a Gift of Damnation of your choice (see Gifts of Damnation).
To bind a mortal's soul to you, you must first create a contract for their desired gift. A contract requires magical ink and paper worth 10 GP for each Transformation Stage you have acquired.

You and the mortal must both sign the contract willingly, fully aware of the costs involved. Once signed, daemonic entities give you a Gift of Damnation, and the mortal receives their desired wishes within 7 days. You do not have to provide this boon yourself.

For example, upon signing a contract for a {@optfeature Gift of Unfettered Glory|GrimHollowPG24}, you receive the benefits listed for that gift. The mortal who signs receives their stated desire, provided by the dubious powers of the Netherworld. You cannot benefit directly from the mortal's desired gift, nor can an ally. No ally of yours can ever sign a contract with you.
You may take a Gift of Damnation of the Stage that you have attained or lower. For example, if you are at Stage 2 of the Transformation, you may only take a Stage 1 or Stage 2 Gift of Damnation.

There is no limit to the number of contracts you can execute, but you can only have one active Gift of Damnation at a time. When you would gain a second Gift of Damnation, you may replace your active gift with the new one. Also, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} you may swap your active Gift of Damnation for any other gift associated with a signed contract.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Smite
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can choose one creature you have just damaged with a weapon attack, an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or a cantrip. Deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Acid, Cold, or Fire damage to that creature, using the same damage type you chose for {@optfeature Fiendish Soul|GrimHollowPG24}. You can add this damage a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage, but no more than once per damage roll. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
At higher Transformation Stages, you do an additional {@damage 1d6} of damage per Transformation Stage, for a total of {@dice 2d6} at Stage 2, {@dice 3d6} at Stage 3, and {@dice 4d6} at Stage 4.

optionalfeature.name: Fiend Bound
entries: Your body and soul are bound to the Netherworld. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as the plane attempts to pull you into it.

optionalfeature.name: Daemonic Brand
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, you can brand a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see with a fiery mark that remains on them for 1 minute. If the target succeeds on a Wisdom saving throw, they are not branded. The DC of the saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.
If the creature fails the saving throw, you choose one of the following effects that lasts for the duration:

items: The creature takes a -2 penalty on all saving throws.
The first attack against the creature on each turn is made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
The creature cannot regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Contract
entries: You may switch between your active Gift of Damnation at the end of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. In addition, when you switch Gifts of Damnation, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 times your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Fiend Form
entries: Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your skin becomes red and leathery, and vicious horns, teeth and nails erupt through the surface of your skin. You can suppress this form and present the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires effort. Moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. In the following situations your true form may be revealed:

items: Entering the presence of Celestials or other Fiends.

entries: In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage. If you fail this save, your Horrific Appearance is revealed.
Non-evil creatures will typically be instantly {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Devilish Subcontractor
entries: You may gain the benefits of two Gifts of Damnation at the same time. You may still only switch one Gift of Damnation after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Overwhelming Brand
entries: You can apply one of the following additional effects to a creature under the effect of your {@optfeature Daemonic Brand|GrimHollowPG24}.

items: The creature's {@variantrule Speed|GrimHollowPG24} is halved, and you can move the creature up to 10 feet horizontally on your turn (no action required).
The creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition. On your turn, you can choose to remove this condition (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Pull of the Netherworld
entries: Your new native plane attempts to pull you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you take {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage as the denizens of the fiendish plane attempt to unbind your soul from the Material Plane. This damage can only be taken once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short}, and it ignores all {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}. If this damage reduces your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to 0, you die and your soul is immediately taken to the Netherworld. You can only be returned to life by spells of 7th level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Abyssal Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the damage type chosen for {@optfeature Fiendish Soul|GrimHollowPG24}, and you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the other two damage types. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage from nonmagical weapon attacks or {@variantrule Unarmed Strikes|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Summons
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can tear open a portal to the Netherworld and summon up to four {@filter Fiends of CR 4|bestiary|source=|Challenge Rating=[&0;&4]|type=fiend} or lower within 30 feet of you. The Fiends remain for 1 minute (or less, if the GM decides what Fiends answer the summons).

The summoned Fiends are {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your companions. They act directly after you in the initiative order. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they use the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action on their turn and take no other movement, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions} unless it is to protect themselves.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Brand
entries: When a creature affected by your {@optfeature Daemonic Brand|GrimHollowPG24} starts its turn, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to dictate its move and the action it takes. If you do, the creature repeats the initial Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a success, you can't use this {@action Reaction|XPHB} again while your brand lasts.

optionalfeature.name: True Name
entries: Your Fiend transformation is complete, and you are reborn. You are assigned a new name by the denizens of the Netherworld, which becomes your True Name. You receive a talisman of brimstone and brass with your true name inscribed in Infernal on it.

A creature with a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 10 or higher within 10 feet of you that knows your True Name can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and speak your True Name. You must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or suffer the following effects for 1 minute. You may attempt a Charisma saving throw at the end of each of your turns to end the effects.

items: You have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition, even if you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, the entity that has spoken your True Name can force you to move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and use your action to attack with a weapon, use your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or cast a cantrip against a target of their choice.
All attacks against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws.
You cannot regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. You immediately lose any {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you have.

optionalfeature.name: Hag Form
entries: Your {@variantrule Creature Type|XPHB} becomes Fey in addition to any other creature type(s) you have.

Additionally, your connection with the magic of the natural world provides you with increased defenses. When you are not wearing armor, your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} is 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, choose Strength, Intelligence, or Charisma: you are proficient with Saving Throws using that ability score.

optionalfeature.name: The Green Sisterhood
entries: Green Hags are skilled deceivers who collect corrupting magic and secret curses. They use their magic to twist pure into foul, poking at the weaknesses of their foes. Green Hags embrace magical deceptions and are known for their vile recipes. There are no worse cooks in Etharis.

items: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 60 feet.
You become Amphibious and can breathe both air and water.
You can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices.

entries: A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a {@action Study|XPHB} action and a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check with a DC equal to 8 plus your Charisma modifier plus your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: The Red Sisterhood
entries: Red Hags are sometimes called the "nice" hags due to their ability to pretend to be helpful, but their kindness is a mask. While they are more subtle than other Hags and may choose to do good deeds, their motives are selfish. They delight in using honeyed words and offering deals that are just too good to pass up.

items: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.
You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}. If you are already proficient, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} instead.
You are immutable. No effect can change your form, and an illusion can disguise you only if the illusion gives you the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: The Sea Sisterhood
entries: Sea Hags enjoy spreading chaos. They hate order and calm, creating elaborate deceptions that lead to despair when uncovered. Their appearances are especially hideous, and their gaze can cause fear, or even kill. You gain the following benefits.

items: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

You become Amphibious and can breathe both air and water. You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. If you already have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB}, it increases by 10 feet.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can gaze upon a creature you can see within 30 feet. If the creature fails a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 plus your Charisma modifier plus your Transformation Stage, it takes {@damage 1d8} Psychic damage for each Transformation Stage you have.

optionalfeature.name: Hideous Appearance (Hag)
entries: Your appearance is grotesquely transformed. Your body, hair, and eyes change in ways mortals find abhorrent. Most creatures witnessing your true form become {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} and no one is likely to trust you, unless the GM decides otherwise. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) checks.

You cannot stand to look upon your own reflection. The first time you see your reflection after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
Your appearance changes based on your Stage 1 Sisterhood Boon:

entries.name: Green Sisterhood
entries: You wither or bloat as your body struggles to deal with the ravages of age. Your hair becomes white and several feet in length. Your skin becomes green and covered in warts and boils.

entries.name: Red Sisterhood
entries: Your eyes have turned entirely red, and your pupils are narrow like a cat's. Your skin becomes blood red.

entries.name: Sea Sisterhood
entries: You have slimy scales and the pallid skin of a dead fish that sags from your emaciated body. Your hair resembles seaweed, and your eyes are glassy.

optionalfeature.name: Adept of the Green Sisterhood
entries: As your connection to your Green Sisterhood grows, your body and your magical skills strengthen.

items: You gain a Claw attack that deals {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing {@variantrule Damage|XPHB}. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

You can hide yourself from others. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Adept of the Red Sisterhood
entries: As your connection to your Red Sisterhood grows, your body and your magical skills strengthen.

items: You gain a Claw attack that deals {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing {@variantrule Damage|XPHB}. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

You can sway others to your will. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. The spell save DC when cast in this way is 12 plus your Transformation Stage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Adept of the Sea Sisterhood
entries: As your connection to your Sea Sisterhood grows, your body and your magical skills strengthen.

items: You gain a Claw attack that deals {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing {@variantrule Damage|XPHB}. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

You can appear as someone other than yourself. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. The spell save DC when cast in this way is 12 plus your Transformation Stage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Sensitivity
entries: Your body and soul connect back to the Realm of Faerie, and iron and steel weapons forged of the mortal realm cause you pain. After each {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the first time you are damaged by an iron or steel weapon, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Master of the Green Sisterhood
entries: You come into your power as a Hag and enhance your abilities.

items: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you may make an additional Claw attack. Your Claw attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Poison damage.

You learn a corrupt ritual to create a Hag Eye or a {@creature Gasdra|GrimHollowPG24} companion. The ritual takes four hours and 200 GP to complete. You choose which ritual you know when you select this boon. You can only have one Hag Eye or Gasdra companion at a time, and you cannot have both.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can recover an expended spell slot by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} equal to the spell slot's level. The spell slot can have a level equal to no more than one third your character level (round up). Once you use this boon, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Master of the Red Sisterhood
entries: You come into your power as a Hag and enhance your abilities.

items: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you may make an additional Claw attack. Your Claw attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d4} Psychic damage. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Psychic damage dealt.

Your banter becomes supernaturally charming. A creature under your magical influence (such as being {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you) who is able to hear you for 1 minute must must make a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to 14 plus your Transformation Stage. On a failed save, when your mental influence ends, the target forgets magic was used to influence it. You regain use of this feature after you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} to cast the {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Master of the Sea Sisterhood
entries: You come into your power as a Hag and enhance your abilities.

items: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you may make an additional Claw attack. Your Claw attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage.

Your appearance becomes so vile that it terrifies mortal creatures. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gaze upon a Beast or Humanoid within 30 feet that can see your true form. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 14 plus your Charisma modifier. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn. A target that succeeds is immune to this feature for 24 hours. You regain use of this feature after you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend and roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} to touch a creature and allow the target to breathe water for a number of minutes equal to the amount rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Purity's Pain
entries: Unspoiled, pure things cause you physical pain to witness. A child hugging their parent, a loyal dog laying its head upon a sick man's lap, a work of religious art devoted to an Arch Seraph, a baby's laughter: these things make you physically ill.

When you are in the presence of a pure act or object (GM's discretion) you are wracked with pain. At the start of each of your turns while you can see the cause of your pain, you suffer {@dice 3d6} plus your Charisma modifier Psychic damage, and cannot use a Hag Transformation boons until the start of your next turn. The first time you take Psychic damage from this flaw after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. If you fail, you have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition as long as you can see the source of your pain.

optionalfeature.name: Evil Eye
entries: Your visage is so horrifying that you can cause creatures to drop dead when your gaze falls upon them. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you gaze upon a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} Beast or Humanoid within 30 feet that can see your true form. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 14 plus your Charisma modifier. If the target fails the save, it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. On a successful save, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} Psychic damage. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Grandmother's Curse
entries: You learn one Shadowsteel curse of your choice. You always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. You can cast it once per day without using a spell slot or needing spell components.

optionalfeature.name: Arch-Crone's Hunger
entries: You develop a taste for strange, cursed, or vile foods, and normal food no longer nourishes you. You must consume one of these unusual foods at least once every day or you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, which cannot be removed until you feed your vile hunger. If you are forced to eat or drink normal food, you must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or vomit it up and gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
Examples of vile foods include the following:

items: The flesh of sapient creatures (Humanoids, Fey, or Celestials)
Magical ingredients (rare herbs, dragon's blood, etc.)
The pain and suffering of others

optionalfeature.name: Undead Form
entries: You become an Undead in addition to any other creature type(s). You cannot be excluded from Turn Undead.
You also stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you cannot die from old age. You do not require air, food, drink, or sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Lich Magica
entries: You can trade the soul in your soul vessel for increased magical power.
On your turn, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend the charge in your soul vessel to gain one of the following effects:

items: Regain a spell slot equal to or lower than your current Lich Transformation Stage.
The next saving throw made before the end of your next turn against one of your spells has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.
The next time you cast a spell before the end of your next turn, deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Necrotic damage per Lich Transformation Stage to one creature damaged by that spell.

The next time you cast a spell before the end of your next turn that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, that spell restores an additional {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per Lich Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Memori Lichdom
entries: While your soul vessel is charged, you gain the following benefits to your weapon attacks or {@variantrule Unarmed Strikes|XPHB}:

items: They have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if taken as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

After you deal damage with a weapon attack or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can spend a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on that turn and expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. Roll the die and deal Necrotic damage equal to the result to one target damaged by the triggering attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Vessel
entries: You have successfully torn your soul from your body and trapped it in a suitable object. The object must be a trinket or item no larger than 1 cubic foot in size. This item becomes your soul vessel.

entries.name: Soul Vessel
entries: A soul vessel is an enchanted vessel containing a Lich's soul. Additionally, a soul vessel is a conduit for the lich to feed on captured souls. A soul vessel has the following statistics:

items: {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}: 10 x your Character Level
{@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Damage Immunities}: Poison, Psychic; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from non-magical sources
{@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Damage Resistances}: Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from magical sources

entries: While a soul is stored in your soul vessel, the soul vessel is considered charged. The soul contained within the soul vessel must be from a creature whose {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} is equal to or higher than half your Character Level. The soul vessel can only contain one soul at a time.
You can add a soul to the soul vessel 2 times for each of your Transformation Stages. You regain this ability when you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

To store a soul within the soul vessel, the lich must use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action within 1 minute of a creature's death, or a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} triggered by the creature's death, while holding the vessel to capture the soul, and the dead creature'sbody must be within 60 feet of the vessel when the capture occurs. The creature cannot be returned to life until its soul is removed from your soul vessel.

If your soul vessel is reduced to 0 hit points, you must create a new one. Doing so takes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Until you do, you do not gain any of the benefits of having the soul vessel. Also, until you have a soul vessel, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} you make after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

If you are killed while you control a charged soul vessel on the same plane of existence, your soul vessel's charge is consumed. You are brought back to life as per the {@spell Resurrection|XPHB} spell within 5 feet of your soul vessel 1 day later. If you are killed and your soul vessel is not charged, you are resurrected 7 days later instead.

optionalfeature.name: Acolyte of Undeath
entries: When you reduce a Humanoid to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and it dies, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately transform it into a {@creature Zombie|XMM} under your control. You can have three such creatures under your control at once. These Zombies act on their own {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, following your verbal commands to the best of their ability.

optionalfeature.name: Binding Curse
entries: You can compel a creature with a binding curse. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature within 30 feet who can see you. That creature makes a Charisma saving throw against a DC of 12 plus your Transformation Stage. On a failed save it cannot move more than 30 feet away from you for 1 minute. Also, during that time, your weapon attacks and {@variantrule Unarmed Strikes|XPHB} against the creature deal an additional {@dice 2d6} Necrotic damage.
You can use this feature three times, regaining all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Corrupting Magic
entries: Whenever you kill any creature with a spell, you may apply an additional effect depending on the damage dealt. This ability cannot be used when you kill a Construct, Undead, or any creature without a soul.
Choose one of the following effects when you use this ability:

entries.name: Life Force
entries: As the soul of your enemy leaves their body, you siphon off part of their life force. You regain {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per Transformation Stage.

entries.name: Poison
entries: Choose a creature within 10 feet of the killed creature. That creature takes {@damage 1d6} Poison damage per Transformation Stage.

entries.name: Exhaustion
entries: Choose a creature within 10 feet of the killed creature. That creature gains one {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. A creature may only have one {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level from this feature at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Hideous Appearance (Lich)
entries: Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your flesh withers and contracts around your bones, your eyes become sunken, and you reek of death. Regardless of your true form, you're horrific to behold.

You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires effort. This form is not permanent, and moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. Your true form may be revealed in the following situations:

In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call or a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage. If you fail this save, your Horrific Appearance is revealed.
Non-evil creatures that witness your true form become instantly {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Concentration
entries: Your supernatural ability with magic manifests in new ways. When you cast a spell that requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, if you are already {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on one such spell, you can spend the charge of your soul vessel. If you do this, you do not lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the original spell. Instead, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

If you cast a third {@status Concentration|XPHB} spell during this time, or lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} for any other reason, you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on both current spells you are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on.
Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Undeath
entries: Undead creatures under your control from a Lich Transformation Boon have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls when they are within 5 feet of you.

Additionally, whenever an Undead creature you control due to a Lich Transformation Boon is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can spend the charge of your soul vessel as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. If you do, that Undead creature is at 1 hit point instead and may immediately move up to its full speed and make an {@action Attack|XPHB} action with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. This feature has no effect if the creature has been reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by Radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unholy Healing
entries: Your magical connection to your soul vessel restores your vitality quickly. While your soul vessel is charged, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to draw healing power from it. At the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, you regain 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The soul vessel does not lose its charge.
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Necromantic Dystrophia
entries: When your soul vessel is not charged, you suffer the following effects:

items: You cannot use the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Dodge|XPHB}, or {@action Disengage|XPHB} actions.
You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws.
You cannot disguise your {@optfeature Hideous Appearance (Lich)|GrimHollowPG24|Hideous Appearance}.

entries: Upon charging your soul vessel with an appropriate soul, you are no longer subject to these effects.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Omniscience
entries: Your supernatural ability with magic manifests in new ways. When you cast a spell that requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, if you are already {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on one such spell, you can spend the charge of your soul vessel. If you do this, you do not lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the original spell. Instead, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

If you cast a third {@status Concentration|XPHB} spell during this time, or lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} for any other reason, you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on both current spells you are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on.
Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Lord of Undeath
entries: When you use {@optfeature Acolyte of Undeath|GrimHollowPG24} you can choose to transform the target into a {@creature Ghoul|XMM} instead of a {@creature Zombie|XMM}.

optionalfeature.name: Soul-Shattering Attack
entries: After you make a weapon attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can spend the charge in your soul vessel to add the {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of the soul within it to the attack roll and damage dealt with that attack. If the creature dies from that attack, you can instantly recharge your soul vessel with the soul that you just expended.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to 4 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Weight of the Ages
entries: The weight of time is degrading for your form, and only the magic of your soul vessel holds it together. If your soul vessel is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, your soul is lost; you are killed instantly and your body crumbles to dust.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze Form
entries: You become an Ooze in addition to any other creature type(s) you are. You gain {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet. If you already have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, your range increases by 30 feet.

You can will your body to melt and flow, becoming more fluid than solid. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you manifest your Ooze Form. You become amorphous, able to move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement, and you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions. You remain in Ooze Form for 1 minute or until you use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to return to normal.

You can manifest your Ooze Form a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation stage. You regain all uses of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Mutable Corpus
entries: You have abundant control over your Ooze Form. Each time you manifest your Ooze Form, choose one of the following augmentations:

items: {@i Breathless}. You do not need to breathe.

{@i Disguise}. You remold your features to look different. You can change your apparent species, seem 1 foot shorter or taller, and appear heavier or lighter (you must keep the same basic arrangement of limbs). To discern the disguise, a creature must take the {@action Study|XPHB} action and succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against DC 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Transformation Stage.
{@i Transparent}. Your body becomes transparent. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Slimy Mien
entries: While manifesting your Ooze Form, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.
Your {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} range increases by 30 feet.

You can communicate with Oozes within 30 feet as if you shared a language. Oozes are not automatically {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you, but they do not regard you as food and may respond to simple questions if they are not {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile}.

optionalfeature.name: Sluggish
entries: Your body frequently shifts and melts without control, making you sluggish. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} decreases by 5 feet for every Transformation Stage you achieve.
In addition, your skin glistens with oozy droplets leaving a trail anywhere you go. Ability checks made to follow your tracks are made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Elastic Limbs
entries: Your limbs have become elastic and tacky, allowing you to reach distant enemies and climb walls.

Your reach increases by 5 feet and you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. Creatures you are grappling have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) checks to escape.

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Durability
entries: Your mind and body become more Ooze-like. You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition and Acid damage.
When you gain this Boon, choose Cold, Fire, or Lightning; you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Melted Appearance
entries: Your body is now a hideous lump of dripping flesh excreting foul smelling slime. While your form remains roughly humanoid, the horror of what you are is clear to anyone that looks upon your molten face. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} when you use the {@action Influence|XPHB} action to make Charisma-based ability checks made against creatures that are not Aberrations or Oozes.

In addition, your Transformation to an Ooze has liquefied many of your organs and dimmed your senses. Your eyes melt and run down your face and there is nothing but flesh where your ears once were. You permanently have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition beyond the range of your {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Membrane
entries: When you manifest your Ooze Form, it lasts for 10 minutes.

While manifesting your Ooze Form, you are covered with a sheen of acidic slime. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, it takes Acid damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Transformation Stage. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting you and dealing damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative -1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage or coming into contact with you. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell on the weapon.
Additionally, you can eat through 2 feet of nonmagical wood or metal in 1 minute simply by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Engulf
entries: When you manifest your Ooze Form, it lasts for 10 minutes.

While manifesting your Ooze Form, you can envelop your foes in your gooey body. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can try to engulf a creature of your size category or smaller that is within 5 feet of you. The target makes a Strength saving throw, with a DC equal to 10 plus your Strength modifier plus your Transformation Stage. On a failure, the creature is engulfed.

While engulfed, a target has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside of you, and when you move, the engulfed target moves with you. While engulfed, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} Acid damage at the start of each of its turns, is suffocating, has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. An engulfed creature that is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} is fully digested, leaving no body or nonmagical equipment behind.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Deterioration
entries: Your skin sloughs away in thick, syrupy sheets and your bones become like melted wax. The sun itself burns you, and holy light becomes lethal. Now your reactions slow as much as your pace.
You are {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Radiant damage, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Legion of Slime
entries: When you manifest your Ooze Form, it lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While you are manifesting your Ooze Form and you are hit by an attack that causes you to become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to split into two identical Oozes. Each Ooze uses your game statistics, except that they are one size category smaller than your normal size, and your remaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum are divided evenly between the two Oozes (round down). Your equipment is not duplicated; all of it remains on one of the Oozes.

Each Ooze acts on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. They can each move independently, but they can only collectively take one action and {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn and one {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} per round.
After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Mimic Object
entries: When you manifest your Ooze Form, it lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While manifesting your Ooze Form, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to transform into an object of your size or up to two sizes smaller. Any equipment worn or carried is dropped in your space. While mimicking an object, you retain your statistics.

While mimicking an object, you are indistinguishable from the object and you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are touched to adhere to the creature that touches you. The creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. The DC to escape is equal to DC equal to 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your Transformation Stage. Ability checks made to escape this grapple have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery Ego
entries: As your brain becomes just one more part of the gooey mass that is you, and your sense of self becomes ever more tentative, the slightest distraction can cause you to forget who you were.

The first time you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} after a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, or whenever you roll a 1 on a saving throw, the pain or surprise causes you lose your grip on your mind. You can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. You are overwhelmed with hunger and take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your next turn to make melee attacks against a random creature within reach. If there are no creatures within reach, you move until you are adjacent to the nearest creature, using the {@action Dash|XPHB} action if necessary.

You may attempt a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of your turns to regain your sense of self. This effect ends automatically when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Form
entries: You become an Elemental in addition to any other creature type(s).
Your Constitution score increases by 1, but cannot increase above 20 in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: Though you have sway over all the elements, your Primordial change was sparked by one particular element: your Elemental Affinity. This element infuses your form and dictates your powers. You must choose one element below and gain all the benefits of that element:

items.name: Air
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make an attack with a Ranged weapon or ranged spell, you can make that attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. If you are in a location without air—such as underwater or in a vacuum—this feature has no effect.

items.name: Earth
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning damage. In addition, whenever you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain additional {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Fire
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal Fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

items.name: Water
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 30 feet regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains an additional {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding (Primordial)
entries: Your body and soul are connected to the Elemental Plane. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as the plane attempts to pull you into it.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Nature
entries: You add a second element to your {@optfeature Elemental Affinity|GrimHollowPG24|Elemental Affinity Boon}. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Surge
entries: You can channel pure elemental energy into a concentrated bolt of an element of your choice. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use any of the following options:

items.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can make a ranged attack targeting a creature within 60 feet. You are proficient with this attack, which uses your Constitution modifier. On a hit, this attack deals {@dice 3d8} plus your Constitution modifier Lightning damage. You can then use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target another creature within 30 feet of the first target with the same attack.
Increase the damage of these attacks by {@dice 1d8} for each Transformation Stage above 2.

items.name: Earth Shard
entries: You can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d6} plus your Constitution modifier, or half as much on a successful save. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d6} for each Transformation Stage above 2.
You also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the damage dealt.

items.name: Flame Wave
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} originating from you makes a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your Transformation Stage. On a failed save, creatures in the area take Fire damage equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Constitution modifier. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each Transformation Stage above 2.

items.name: Aquatic Rejuvenation
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Constitution modifier. Increase the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} regained by {@dice 1d8} for each Transformation Stage above 2.

items: You can use Elemental Surge a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses upon finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Roiling Elements
entries: Your physical vessel strains to contain the roiling elements trapped inside of you. In a moment of distraction your body may erupt momentarily to reveal your Primordial nature. Tongues of flame may lash out or arcs of lightning might burst from beneath your skin.

You can contain the elements and maintain the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires effort. Moments of stress are likely to unleash your true nature, which might occur under the following circumstances:

items: Having the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions

entries: In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, the GM can call for a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage:

When your Primordial nature is revealed, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on every {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} you make for 1 minute as you fight to control the volatile elements within you.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Awakening
entries: You emit an aura of power that awakens the elemental forces in your companions. When you first gain this feature, choose one of the options below. You may change the aura you emit upon finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Light as Air
entries: Whenever you or an ally you can see within 30 feet of you makes a Dexterity saving throw, the creature gains a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Forged in Fire
entries: When an ally within 10 feet of you deals damage with a melee attack, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make the attack deal Fire damage instead of the normal damage type, and add {@damage 2d6} Fire damage to the attack's damage.

entries.name: Heart of Stone
entries: You can choose to have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on any {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} check. If you do, as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you and each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@dice 1d10} plus your Constitution modifier. While a creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} gained in this manner, they cannot have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition unless it is part of the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Fluid Movement
entries: When an ally within 30 feet moves or attempts to escape a Grapple, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give them the following benefits:

items: Their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet until the end of their turn.
Their movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
They have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks to escape the Grapple.

optionalfeature.name: Primeval Body
entries: Your transformation to an Elemental creature has changed your body entirely. You no longer need to sleep, breathe, or eat. Also, you no longer age normally and suffer no effects of aging.

Additionally, choose one damage type from Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type. If you already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to it.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Many
entries: You add a third elemental to your {@optfeature Elemental Affinity|GrimHollowPG24|Elemental Affinity Boon}. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Imbalance
entries: Your body reacts in strange ways to the application of severe elemental damage. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1, your Primordial form reacts in a volatile manner, and the following effects occur:

items: You gain {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to the instance of damage you just took, even if you had {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage.
Creatures within 5 feet of you take the original amount of damage that you took. A DC 15 Constitution saving throw halves this damage.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Aura
entries: Creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage. You choose the damage type after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and you can change the damage type as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If they already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to any of these damage types, they gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: You add the final element to you Elemental Affinity Boon. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

Additionally, you can summon the four elements to wreathe you in power. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, dealing {@damage 6d6} damage of a type of your choice from Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning, or half as much on a successful save.
After you use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, your Elemental Affinity features gain the following benefits until the end of your next turn

entries.name: Air
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Ranged weapon and ranged spell attacks.

entries.name: Earth
entries: At the beginning of your turn, you gain 20 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fire
entries: At the beginning of your turn, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Whenever a creature withing 60 feet that you can see regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or through a spell or magical ability, that creature regains an additional 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses upon completing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Chaos
entries: The plane of Primordial energy that you're tied to strengthens its pull on you. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a spell, you take {@damage 8d6} Force damage, which ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}. This damage is in addition to any normal damage from the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Fanged Bite
entries: As an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make a Bite attack. You are considered proficient with this attack, and you can use Strength or Dexterity as the ability. This attack deals Piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier. This Bite attack is not a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

If the attack hits a creature that has blood, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt this way. The DC is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Soman Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Soman bloodline, the most prevalent in Etharis. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength and Dexterity scores increase by 1. Neither score can exceed 19 with this feature.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}.
The Necrotic damage dealt by {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} increases to {@dice 1d8}.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fzeg Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Fzeg bloodline, a line of vampires that combines the affliction with lycanthropy. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength score increases by 2. Your Strength score cannot exceed 20 with this feature.

You gain a Claw attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength modifier Slashing damage, using your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} on attack rolls. This Claw attack is not a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to make the Claw attack, you may use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a Bite attack from {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}.

optionalfeature.name: Strigoi Bloodline
entries: Your vampirism follows the Strigoi bloodline. Your speed and guile almost match your ferocity. You gain the following features:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 2. Your Dexterity score cannot exceed 20 with this feature.
If you make your {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, the Piercing damage increases to {@dice 2d4} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, and you can use the {@action Hide|XPHB} action anywhere that is not in sunlight.
You have proficiency with the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill. If you are already proficient in {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in Stealth instead.

optionalfeature.name: The Sanguine Curse
entries: The Sanguine Curse has taken hold of you. As a result, you gain the following features:

items: You cannot enter a private residence that you do not own without one of the occupants inviting you. Once invited, you can enter without penalty as long as the inviter resides there. If you do enter uninvited, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} while in the residence. Additionally, you take {@damage 1d4} Psychic damage at the start of each of your turns. You cannot be {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Psychic damage while inside such a residence uninvited.
You must feed at least once within seven days of your last feeding. See the Feeding sidebar for more information.

entries.name: Feeding
entries: As a Vampire transforms further and further from its mortal form, its metabolic requirements change. The first change is a need for mortal blood. This need is approximately 1 pint of blood from a Humanoid, Beast, or other creature with mortal blood.

As an action, you can bite a living creature within 5 feet that is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you, or that has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. You drain the target of one pint of blood (or similar life-giving substance), leaving a visible bite mark on that creature. The bitten creature gains one {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

A Vampire that does not feed within the required time enters a rabid feeding frenzy under the GM's control. They attack the nearest creature they could feed from. A Vampire remains in this state until they have drained a creature completely (killing them), at which point the Vampire falls {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} for 4 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Night
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, the range increases by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Grave-Touched Soul
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. If you already have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} instead.

optionalfeature.name: Inhuman Reflexes
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Resilience
entries: You become supernaturally tough to kill. When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by any type of damage except Radiant, you can choose to be reduced to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Sanguine Curse
entries: Your curse has taken a stronger hold onto you. You gain the following features:

items: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} when you are in sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiler's Charm
entries: You gain the ability to manipulate the mind of a creature with your unearthly charm. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose a Humanoid or Beast within 30 feet of you that can see you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC of 8 plus your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 24 hours. At the end of the 24 hours, you can choose to automatically renew the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition on that creature with no saving throw. You may only have one creature {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this manner at a time. If you use this feature on another creature, or you or an ally damages the creature, the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends on the previous creature immediately.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Fanged Bite
entries: As an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make 2 {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attacks. Additionally, you can make a {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} if you don't make a {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action on the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Form
entries: You can cast the {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} spell a number of times equal to your Vampire Transformation Stage without using a spell slot or needing to use Verbal, Somatic, or Material components. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can cast this spell as an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} on your turn, or as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you would take Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage. You cast the spell before taking the damage.

optionalfeature.name: Sangromancy Specialist

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Vampire|GrimHollowPG24|Vampire Transformation}, Spellcaster who can cast cantrips

entries: Your magic is tinged with the blood that you crave. You gain the following features:

items: You gain an extra {@dice 1d12} Sangromancy {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} per Vampire Transformation. You can use those dice on Sangromancy spells. You regain all spent Sangromancy Dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you successfully restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} using {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24}, you regain one spent Sangromancy Die.

Any cantrip you cast that does Necrotic damage can be enhanced by your Sangromancy Dice. You can spend up to 2 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} (including your Sangromancy Dice) to deal extra Necrotic damage with those cantrips. You can decide to spend these {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} after you know if the cantrip affects the target(s).

optionalfeature.name: Supreme Sanguine Curse
entries: Your curse continues to transform you, bringing about further debilitations. You gain the following features:

items: If you start your turn in sunlight, you take {@damage 1d10} Radiant damage. You cannot have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} or {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to this Radiant {@variantrule Damage|XPHB}.

Your appearance begins to resemble that of a true vampire. In stressful conditions, as determined by you or the GM, your appearance changes outside of your control. When you do, anyone observing you knows your true nature.

entries: You can hide your true appearance and disguise yourself as the humanoid you once were by {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on your composure. However, moments of bloodlust or stress are likely to reveal your true nature, including the following situations:

In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call or a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage.  If you fail this save, your Sanguine Curse is revealed.
Non-evil creatures that witness your true form become instantly {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Final Soman Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Soman Bloodline. You gain the following features:

items: Your Strength and Dexterity scores increase by 1 to a maximum of 20.
{@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24|Fanged Bite's} Necrotic damage increases to {@dice 3d8}.

When a Humanoid creature is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by your {@optfeature Fanged Bite|GrimHollowPG24} attack or through your feeding, it rises as a {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM} 24 hours later unless the body is destroyed or undergoes rituals to prevent its rising. You can have two {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM|Vampire Spawns} created this way under your control, and they follow your verbal commands to the best of their abilities. If you take control of a third {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM}, you choose one of the other {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM} you currently control to no longer follow your commands.

optionalfeature.name: Final Fzeg Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Fzeg Bloodline. You have the following features:

items: Your Strength score increases by 2 points to a maximum of 20.

The damage done by your Claw attack becomes {@dice 3d6} plus your Strength modifier Slashing damage, using your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} on attack rolls. You can also make three Claw attacks with an {@action Attack|XPHB} action.
You are {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. Magic and silvered weapons ignore this {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Final Strigoi Bloodline
entries: You reach the full manifestation of your Strigoi Bloodline. You have the following features:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 2 points to a maximum of 20.

You can summon {@dice 2d4} {@creature Swarms of Rats|XMM}, {@creature Swarms of Bats|XMM}, or {@creature Wolf|XMM|Wolves} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. They appear at the start of your next turn within 60 feet of you. They follow your verbal or mental commands. They disperse after 1 hour, when you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or when you dismiss them with a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You regain this ability after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can cast the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell up to four times without using a spell slot. You can also cast a spell in this way as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are targeted with a weapon attack. You cast the spell before taking damage. You regain this ability after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampiric blood that flows in your veins gives you regenerative powers. You regain 15 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} but less than 60 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. This feature has no effect if you are in sunlight or have taken Radiant damage since the end of your last turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Sanguine Curse
entries: Your transformation into a creature of the night is complete. And with that transformation comes susceptibilities. You gain the following features:

items: One strike may end your existence forever. When you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}, and you are struck by a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Piercing Weapon made of wood or silver, you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you die and are reduced to ash. Only a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can resurrect you.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Form
entries: You become a Celestial in addition to any other creature type(s) you are. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant {@variantrule Damage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Angelic Wings
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can manifest feathered wings for 1 hour. While they are manifested, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} when you are not wearing heavy armor.
You can manifest these wings a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Strikes
entries: When you hit with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or damage a creature with a cantrip, you can add {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage to that attack. You can add this damage a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

At higher Transformation Stages, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage per Transformation Stage, for a total of {@dice 2d6} at Stage 2, {@dice 3d6} at Stage 3, and {@dice 4d6} at Stage 4.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding (Seraph)
entries: Your body and soul are bound to the higher planes of good. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as the plane attempts to pull your soul into its place of final reward.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Clemency
entries: When an ally within 30 feet of you that you can see takes damage, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast {@spell Healing Word|XPHB} at first level on that ally without using a spell slot.
You can do this a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Sacred Retribution
entries: When an ally you can see within 30 feet takes the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to imbue them with holy zeal, allowing them to make one additional attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Radiance
entries: Your Transformation into a Seraph brings with it changes to your physical features. Your body radiates a divine glow, your eyes may become hollow braziers of celestial light, or your many sets of wings may appear unsettling to mortal creatures.

You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires effort. This form is not permanent, and moments of stress or wrath are likely to reveal your true nature. This might occur under the following circumstances:

items: Using your Seraph Transformation powers for the first time after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}

entries: In these events, or times of other extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM can call  or a Constitution saving throw with a DC based on your current Transformation Stage.  If you fail this save, your Blinding Radiance is revealed.

When your true nature is revealed this way, all non-enemy creatures within 30 feet of you who can see you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. Additionally, for the next minute, attacks against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cleanse Affliction
entries: When you use Divine Clemency on a creature, they gain the following additional benefits:

items: They gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of damage healed by {@variantrule Healing|XPHB} Word.
They have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on their next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made within the next minute.
You end one of the following conditions on it: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Wings
entries: While you are manifesting your Angelic Wings, you gain the following benefits:

items: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, when you or an ally within 5 feet of you is targeted by a weapon attack, you can impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that attack. If the attack hits the ally, you take half the attack's damage (rounded up) and the original target takes the other half.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws or ability checks to avoid having the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition or to escape a Grapple.
Your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} is increased by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Bow of Celestial Judgement
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to manifest a powerful bow made of divine light. The Bow of Celestial Judgement lasts for 1 minute and grants you the following abilities while manifested:

items: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target a creature you can see within 120 feet with your bow. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} Radiant damage, or {@dice 10d6} if it is a Fey, Fiend, or Undead. On a success, the creature takes half damage.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.
You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Beacon to Darkness
entries: You are now a Seraph of noted virtue and divinity, becoming a target for the world's evil. Whenever you or an ally within 30 feet commits an evil act, such as murdering innocents, you acquire a trace of darkness and you are Corrupted. GMs determine what constitutes an evil act.

While you are Corrupted, whenever you make an attack roll against an evil creature or a saving throw against a spell or effect from an evil creature, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the check. Also, if an ally is the one who caused your Corruption, they cannot be considered your ally or you theirs until the Corruption is removed.

You can remove the Corrupted condition by finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, during which you must pray for at least 1 hour and burn holy incense or donate wealth to a local good cause worth at least 100 GP times your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Holy Purge
