entries: You emit an aura of righteous fervor in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you, except when you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. When an ally within your aura hits with a weapon attack, the ally can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the hit to be a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. If they do, you and the ally each gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. After an ally uses this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that ally can't use it again until after they finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Righteous Mercy
entries: You emit an aura of peaceful resolution in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you, except when you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. When an ally within your aura would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, they can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. If they do, you and the ally each gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. After an ally uses this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that ally can't use it again until after they finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Bow of Celestial Domination
entries: While your Bow of Celestial Judgement is manifested, you gain these additional benefits:

items: When you use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target a creature you can see within 120 feet, you can also affect one other creature with 10 feet of the original target.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage instead of {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.
You gain 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns instead of 5.

optionalfeature.name: Seraph Corruption
entries: The weight of evil in the world encumbers you more and more heavily as the days pass. Sometimes it becomes too much, and your celestial form is wracked with pain and doubt.
Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw, you suffer the following effects for 1 minute:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you take {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
You cannot regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.
You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make every round.
Once per round, the first creature you force to make a saving throw against your spell has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Curser

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: If you do not already have it, you gain the {@feat Shadowsteel Adept|GrimHollowPG24} feat.
Additionally, when you cast a Shadowsteel curse, the casting time is reduced by half, and the saving throw DC increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Weapon

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: During a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you focus upon a Melee weapon within your reach, imbuing it with a fragment of your Shadowsteel corruption. This Shadowsteel weapon is considered magical.
When you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a melee attack made with your Shadowsteel weapon, you gain {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 hour.
You can repeat the process described above to imbue a different weapon with Shadowsteel. This removes the effect from your existing Shadowsteel weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Debilitating Magic

prerequisite.other: Stage 1 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: Choose one ability score. You lose 2 points in that ability as the power of the Shadowsteel slowly eats away at your body, soul, or both.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Absorption

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: As the Shadowsteel courses through you, it begins to harden your flesh. Your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} increases by 1 when you aren't wearing armor.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Caster

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: If you do not already have it, you gain the {@feat Shadowsteel Master|GrimHollowPG24} feat.

Additionally, when you use a Shadowsteel component to cast a spell using a spell slot, you can spend a Hit Die to regain that spell slot. The spell slot level cannot be greater than twice your Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation Stage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. You regain all uses of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Weapon Master

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You gain a +4 bonus to damage rolls made with your {@optfeature Shadowsteel Weapon|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel weapon}.

optionalfeature.name: Friendless

prerequisite.other: Stage 2 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You are no longer able to connect with other creatures on a social level. You prefer isolation and twisted contemplation to friendship and camaraderie.
You cannot be considered an ally to any Humanoids or Beasts, and no living creature can be {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you.
You also have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all Charisma ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Claw

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You gain a Claw attack. This attack uses either your Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls.
You can use this attack twice as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, or once as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The Claw attack deals {@dice 2d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

Additionally, when the Claw attack hits, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with a random Shadowsteel curse at Stage 1. The saving throw DC is 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. A creature already afflicted with a Shadowsteel curse cannot gain another Shadowsteel curse with this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Resistance

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: You heal at a slower rate than normal, whether that healing is magical or natural. Whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain half as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as you should. You still recover all {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Arcane Vessel

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot, the power of your Shadowsteel infection emanates from you. One creature targeted by the spell within 60 feet of you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw to resist the spell, or you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the spell attack roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Fury

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: When you use the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to attack with your {@optfeature Shadowsteel Weapon|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel weapon} or {@optfeature Cursed Claw|GrimHollowPG24}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an additional attack with the same weapon or Claw. This extra attack carries with it the power of the Shadowsteel infection.

When you hit with this attack, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain a 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. The saving throw DC is 8 plus the ability modifier used in the attack plus your Transformation Stage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowsteel Explosion

prerequisite.other: Stage 4 of the {@charoption Shadowsteel Ghoul|GrimHollowPG24|Shadowsteel Ghoul Transformation}

entries: The Shadowsteel that suffuses your flesh responds to stress, and you can do nothing to control it. The first time you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} or reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you risk hurting everyone around you.

When these events occur, all living creatures within 60 feet of you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the area suffer {@damage 4d10} Force damage and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half damage and is not {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Form
entries: You are considered to be Undead in addition to your existing creature type(s). You cannot be excluded from Turn Undead.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. If you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage from another source, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} instead.
Finally, you stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you cannot die from old age.

optionalfeature.name: Ghastly Touch
entries: You can deliver a soul-chilling jolt through your attacks. Once per turn, when you hit a target with a melee attack when you are within 5 feet of the target, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: You are able to loosen the binds that tie you to the material world to move through solid objects and creatures. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can make yourself incorporeal until the start of your next turn. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can move through solid objects at your full {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You take {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside a solid object and are moved to the nearest open space.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage types except Force damage.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Drawn to Darkness
entries: Your body and soul are bound to the cold darkness of the realms of death. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as your life force is drawn to oblivion.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Phasing
entries: You can cast the {@spell Blink|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. You can cast the spell using this Boon a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage, and you regain all uses after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While you are under the effects of Blink when cast in this way, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Haunting Flight
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

Also, while you are flying, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to focus your terrifying presence on one creature you can see within 30 feet. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The DC for the Wisdom saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Untethered from Life
entries: Your life force is weaker than other creatures. When you would regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain half as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Draining Flight

prerequisite.other: Stage 3 of the {@charoption Specter|GrimHollowPG24|Specter Transformation}, {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24} & {@optfeature Haunting Flight|GrimHollowPG24}

entries: You can now use your {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24} feature as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Additionally, your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} while using {@optfeature Haunting Flight|GrimHollowPG24} becomes double your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

Additionally, while you are using {@optfeature Incorporeal Movement|GrimHollowPG24}, your movement does not provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and you can damage creatures that you move through. Once per turn, when you enter a space occupied by a creature, you can choose to force that creature to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage and have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. A creature takes half damage on a successful save and is not {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. The DC of the Constitution saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: Your Ghastly Touch feature takes on a spirit-freezing quality. The damage from your {@optfeature Ghastly Touch|GrimHollowPG24} increases to {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage. Additionally, you can force any creature you damage with {@optfeature Ghastly Touch|GrimHollowPG24} to make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, they have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition instead. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Transformation Stage. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fraying Reality
entries: Your mind begins to slip into the dark places where the world of life and world of death intersect. When you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} for the first time after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you act as though under the effects of a {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Unmaking
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can give a mournful wail or otherwise set up a wracking vibration. This sound has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

All other creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC of the Constitution saving throw is 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} plus your Transformation Stage. Creatures that can't hear you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.
On a failed save, the creature bears the Mark of Unmaking for 1 minute. While bearing this mark, a creature takes an additional {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage each time it takes damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Possession
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you enter the space of a Humanoid or Beast and force that creature to make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If the target fails, you disappear, and the target is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} and loses control of its body. You control the body without depriving the target of awareness.

While possessing a target, you can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. You retain your alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and any {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to having the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions. Otherwise, you use the possessed target's statistics but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, spellcasting abilities or {@action Magic|XPHB} actions, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts for 1 hour, until the possessed target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you end it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or you are forced out by an effect that ends possession. When the possession ends, you reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the possessed creature. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of Oblivion
entries: Your connection to the material realm becomes gossamer thin. When you roll a natural 1 on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you take {@damage 4d6} Force damage, and this damage cannot be mitigated. If this damage reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you die.
When you die in this way or any other, you can only be brought back to life through magic equivalent to level 7 or higher spells.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Wolf Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-wolf creature. While in your hybrid wolf form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Strength score becomes 18 unless it is higher.
Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and you can use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw or Bite attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. These attacks deal {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
After taking an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you may take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later in that turn to attack once with either your Claw or Bite.

entries: Your hybrid wolf form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Bear Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-bear creature. While in your hybrid bear form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Strength score becomes 20 unless it was higher.
You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

Immediately after hitting a target with a Claw attack, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to grab the creature with that hand, as long as it is no more than one size category larger than you. The grabbed target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. The escape DC is 8 plus your Strength modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries: Your hybrid bear form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Rat Form
entries: You become a Monstrosity in addition to any other creature type(s).
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may voluntarily transform into a hybrid half-rat creature. While in your hybrid rat form, the following rules apply:

items: Your Dexterity score becomes 18 unless it was higher.
You can {@action Hide|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
You gain proficiency with {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, and you can double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} when making a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check.
You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
While transformed, you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.

You gain a Claw or Bite attack that you may use in place of any weapon attack. This attack deals {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier Slashing damage. You are proficient with this attack, and you add either your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls. This attack is not an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, nor can it be used in place of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
After taking an {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you may take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later in that turn to attack once with either your Claw or Bite.
If you target a creature that is within 5 feet of one of its enemies, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Claw or Bite attacks made against the target.

entries: Your hybrid rat form lasts 1 hour per Transformation Stage. If you entered your hybrid form voluntarily, you can revert to your normal form by using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn. ({@filter Flaws listed below|optionalfeatures|source=grimhollowpg24|feature type=ly:tf|miscellaneous=} may override this rule.)

optionalfeature.name: Lust for the Hunt
entries: The savage nature of your curse sometimes causes you to lose control. These ferocious tendencies are a constant struggle between you and the beast within.

The first time you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. If you are in the light of a full moon, you automatically fail this saving throw.
If you fail this saving throw, you are subjected to the following rules until you can end the hybrid form:

items: You immediately enter your hybrid form. You go completely feral, and you cannot use any of your equipment or class features.

On your turn while in hybrid form, you must move toward the closest creature you can see, smell, or hear, prioritizing {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creatures. If you end your movement and no creature is within 5 feet of you, you must use the {@action Dash|XPHB} action to move toward the closest one.
If there is a creature within 5 feet of you and you have not used your action, you must make an {@action Attack|XPHB} action using your Claw attack.
When you damage a creature on your turn and it is not reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you must use further attacks that turn against that creature.

entries: If you are at full {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn, you can make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you return to your normal form. You also return to your normal form if {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} is cast on you, or after 1 hour passes.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Focus
entries: While in hybrid form, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mark one creature within 60 feet as your prey. A creature remains marked this way for 1 hour, or until it dies. You may only have 1 creature marked at a time.
While a creature is marked as your prey, you gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you hit the marked creature with a melee attack, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of that attack's type.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}) check you make to find it.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Pelt
entries: While in hybrid form, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. Magical and silvered weapons ignore this {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Kindred Form
entries: You gain the ability to transform into the animal form representative of your Lycanthropy type, known as your Kindred Form. Use the stat block of the creature your lycanthropy corresponds with and follow the rules of the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell:

You are indistinguishable from other creatures of that type, and you can communicate with those creatures. You cannot speak, but you can understand languages you know. All equipment you wear and carry falls off you when transforming.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Sensitivity
entries: You have developed a debilitating sensitivity to silver. In all forms, you have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage from silvered weapons. In addition, you cannot have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage inflicted by silvered weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Bestial Vigor
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum increases by an amount equal to your character level, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a character level.
Additionally, when in your hybrid form, you gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Shapeshifter's Savagery
entries: You have embraced the animalistic side of your transformation. While in your hybrid form, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Claw and Bite attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d8} Slashing damage.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Frayed Thoughts
entries: You suffer the effects of sharing a mind with two personalities. Memories of less practical significance are lost to new ones of midnight hunts. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Form Affinity
entries: You have achieved a state of equilibrium that most Lycanthropes never find. You gain the following benefits while you are voluntarily in your hybrid form:

items: You can cast spells without needing to provide their Verbal or Somatic components. Additionally, you can cast spells without needing to provide material components, provided they do not have a GP value listed.
Allies within 20 feet of you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Instincts
entries: You have developed an unrelenting thirst for bloodshed and carnage. While in your hybrid form, if you hit a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature with a Claw or Bite attack, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Predator
entries: You realize the true cost of your transformation. The beast within has gained more control of your body than you have. While you can control it at times, you know it cannot be contained forever—and when it breaks free, it delights in any slaughter it can find.
You gain the following features:

items: If you can see, hear or smell a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws.

At the start of your turn, if you can see, hear or smell a creature with the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you transform into your hybrid form, or, if already in hybrid form you go feral as described under Lust for Hunt, above. On a success, you are immune to this effect until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Whenever you kill a creature while in your hybrid form, you cannot transform back into your normal form until dawn the next day.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Joyous Life
entries: At the beginning of your turn, if you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can choose to roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} (no action required) and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll. If you roll a 1 on this die, you regain no {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and take 1 point of Force damage instead. You regain this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Prodigious Talent
entries: Choose two Skills. Gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the chosen skills.

If you roll a 1 or 2 on an {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB} using one of the chosen skills, you immediately lose half your maximum number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, rounded down. You do not regain {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} lost this way until you finish two {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unsurpassed Fortune
entries: When an enemy you can see within 10 feet succeeds on an attack roll or a saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll {@dice d20}. On a 6 or higher, the triggering attack or save misses or fails, and you regain the use of your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. Otherwise, you take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage per Transformation Stage, which cannot be reduced. You regain your use of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Liberating Freedom
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while aren't wearing Heavy armor, you can manifest a pair of leathery wings. You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. These wings recede if you dismiss them as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, if you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, or if you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} while they are manifested.

You can have your wing manifested for 1 hour total, including several shorter stints adding up to 1 hour. You regain your ability to use your wings for an hour after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unfettered Glory
entries: Each time you damage a creature with a melee attack, an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or a cantrip, you can do an additional 2 points Force {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} per Transformation Stage.

Each time you roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you regain 2 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} fewer per Hit Die.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Second Chances
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}. If you roll a 2 or better, set your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} total to the result of the roll. If not, you suffer a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure. You regain the use of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unconditional Love
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Transformation Stage. You regain the use of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
If you roll a 1 on the die, you gain no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} and instead have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Martial Prowess
entries: Once per turn, when you miss with a weapon attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reroll the attack roll. If the reroll hits, you must spend 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and add the result to the attack's normal damage as Force damage. If the reroll misses, you must spend 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and take Psychic damage equal to the result. If you have fewer than 3 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} available, you cannot use this gift.
Once you hit a target with an attack using a rerolled attack, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Unbridled Power
entries: Upon finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can spend 2 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and regain a number of spell slot levels equal to the highest number rolled. However, you take Psychic damage equal to twice the total that you rolled. You regain the reuse of this gift when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenal Injection
entries: For 1 minute, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

optionalfeature.name: Allsense Injection
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Eye Oil
entries: For 1 hour, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.
This sense is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bull's Strength
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Cat's Grace
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bear's Endurance
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Fox's Cunning
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Owl's Wisdom
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Eagle's Splendor
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Elfsight Oil
entries: For 8 hours, you have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Fleshknit Phosphate
entries: For 1 minute, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

optionalfeature.name: Ironmind Injection
entries: For 1 hour, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Courage
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Fighter level plus your Constitution modifier. If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain after 1 minute, they vanish.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Rage
entries: For 1 minute, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on hit.

optionalfeature.name: Presto Powder
entries: For 10 minutes, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spellshine Ointment
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Steelskin Ointment
entries: For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tenmen Tincture
entries: For 1 hour, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity, and when you attack with a Melee weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} property for that attack.

table.name: Unstable Form
rows: The stress of your Transformation becomes too much. You die. You cannot be restored to life by any spell below level 5.
Your form becomes fragile. Your Hit Point Maximum is half your normal maximum.
Your body starts to lose cohesion. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.
Your body's metabolism quickly drains your energy. You gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels.
You have trouble processing what is happening. After rolling {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of your first turn.
Your limbs weaken. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (in all modes of movement) decreases by 15 feet and cannot be increased.
Your body does not react quickly to mental commands. You cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.
You are distracted by your changing form. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.
Your body becomes unable to fight off attacks. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws.
You become clumsy. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ability checks.
You lose blood or other vital fluids during your mutations. You cannot add your Constitution modifier to any {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} spent to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Speaking is difficult. You can only utter one word during each turn. This does not hamper spellcasting.
Your lower limbs become more powerful. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet.
Your flesh becomes more hardy. You start the day with 4 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} per Transformation Stage.
Your body's systems are enhanced. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries: {@i Choose A, B, or C:} (A) {@item Scale Mail|XPHB}, {@item Longsword|XPHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Bolt|XPHB|Bolts}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 5 GP; (B) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Scimitar|XPHB}, {@item Shortsword|XPHB}, {@item Longbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Arrow|XPHB|Arrows}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 10 GP; or (C) 160 GP

classFeature.name: Monster Grimoire
entries: You create or inherit a repository of knowledge known as a Monster Grimoire. Each Monster Hunter carries a grimoire, a manual on dangerous creatures. A Monster Hunter's grimoire is an object entirely unique to each hunter. It may be a leather tome recovered from a dusty library with notes made in the margins, a set of blood-stained scrolls inherited from a previous hunter, or a precious stone with a communing spirit held within.

If a Monster Hunter ever loses a grimoire, the hunter has retained enough knowledge to not suffer immediate drawbacks. However, the hunter can't add to the grimoire until it is restored and therefore can't take another Monster Hunter level until a lost grimoire has been replaced. A grimoire can be recreated by spending 8 hours and 50 GP worth of materials such as books, scrolls, and ink.

Choose two types of creatures that you are specialized in hunting from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead.

You add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to Intelligence and Wisdom checks you make that relate to the creature types in your grimoire. For example, if Undead are in your grimoire, you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to an Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB}) check to recall lore about an Undead creature you're investigating or a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check to identify claw marks left on a corpse by an Undead creature. If you are already proficient in a skill when asked to make an Intelligence or Wisdom ability check relating to the monster types in your grimoire, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} instead.
When you gain this feature, you also learn one language based on the chart below. (You can add languages to this chart based on your own campaign world.)

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Longbow|XPHB|Longbows} and {@item Longsword|XPHB|Longswords}. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.
When you reach certain Monster Hunter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Monster Hunter Features table.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.

classFeature.name: Studied Response
entries: You have learned the most effective way to slay a monster is to strike its most vulnerable area at the right moment. Too early, and your attack glances away. Too late, and the monster may eviscerate you.

When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you or another creature with a melee or ranged attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} before the attack roll to make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against that creature.
If the attack misses, you regain the use of your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Monster Hunter Subclass
entries: You gain a Monster Hunter subclass of your choice. The Carver Guild, Devourer Guild, Occultist Guild, and Trapper Guild subclasses are detailed below. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Monster Hunter levels. The guild you choose grants you features when you reach Monster Hunter levels 3, 7, 10, 15, and 18.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Monster Hunter levels 8, 12, 16, and 19.

classFeature.name: Expert Strike
entries: You learn the weaknesses of monsters so that you know exactly where to strike to inflict the most damage. You can add your Intelligence modifier to the attack and damage rolls of your weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: You have expanded your Monster Grimoire with your experience and knowledge.

You can select a third creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a creature type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new type.

Additionally, your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Knowledgeable Defense
entries: You can rely on your knowledge to anticipate a monster's actions and summon your best defense.
Whenever a creature type in your Monster Grimoire forces you to make a saving throw, you can make an Intelligence saving throw in place of that saving throw instead.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: Your Monster Grimoire is further expanded by your encounters and studies.

You can select a fourth creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Constructs, Celestials, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a monster type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new monster type.

classFeature.name: Lair Sense
entries: You are experienced at navigating the threats that arise near a monster's lair. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage of lair actions and regional effects caused by creatures. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage against the Legendary Actions of creature types in your Monster Grimoire.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Slayer's Aid
entries: You're able to coordinate with your allies to quickly slay dangerous monsters.

When you use Studied Response, choose a {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} creature that can see or hear you. That creature can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against the creature that triggered your Studied Response. If the ally does not have their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, they regain it but then must use it to make the attack. Your ally's attack occurs after yours but before the target creature rolls its own attack. This ability refreshes at the start of your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grave Strike
entries: You gain the ability to strike mortal blows against the creatures you have studied.

Your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can now score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 18 through 20 on the {@dice d20}. When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against a creature type in your Monster Grimoire, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC equals the damage taken, up to a maximum DC of 30. On a failed save, the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. On a successful save, the creature takes the attack's normal damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Monster Hunter
entries: Monster Hunters are skilled professionals, specializing in identifying, tracking, and slaying monsters that threaten the lives and the livelihoods of the people of Etharis.

Each Monster Hunter trains in a different method for these tasks. Some hunters don heavy armor and carry shields to protect against crushing jaws and scything claws, others deploy cunning traps to keep a safe distance from the horrors they hunt, some assume the traits and powers of their enemies to better slay them, and others dabble in magic to supplement martial prowess with arcane wrath.

subclass.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
subclassFeatures: Path of the Primal Spirit|Barbarian|XPHB|Primal Spirit|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
subclassFeatures: Path of the Wrathful Dead|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|3
Death Is but a Door|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|10

subclass.name: Warrior of the Leaden Crown
subclassFeatures: Warrior of the Leaden Crown|Monk|XPHB|Leaden Crown|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Eldritch Domain
subclassFeatures: Sing the Song that Ends the World|Cleric|XPHB|Eldritch|GrimHollowPG24|17

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Fractured
entries: {@i Two Personalities Are Better than One}

Barbarians are defined by their rage, channeling it to unleash brief but potent destruction. Few are brave or unwise enough to study esoteric psychological techniques that split their rage from the rest of their psyche, dividing their identity into two parts: ego and id. When their ego is in control, the Fractured—as these Barbarians are known—possess self-control and cunning beyond most other Barbarians. When they allow their id to take control, their countenance turns monstrous and their bodies swell with the power of rage made physically manifest.

subclassFeature.name: Face of Rage
entries: When you activate your Rage, your countenance distorts and your body swells. Creatures that haven't witnessed your transformation, now or previously, don't recognize you. In addition, while your Rage is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can roll {@dice 1d8} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and whenever you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can push it 10 feet or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
You count as one size larger when determining the success or failure of a Grapple, and when you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, your reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

subclassFeature.name: Mask of Civility
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. In addition, you gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice or you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Brains and Brawn
entries: While your Rage is not active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage. While your Rage is active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to every damage type except Force and Psychic.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning and Brutal
entries: While your Rage is not active, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While your Rage is active, your attack rolls with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Better Half
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead, and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. In addition, if your Rage is active, your Rage ends. If your Rage was not active, you immediately activate your Rage (even if you have no remaining uses of your Rage). If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain after 1 minute, they vanish.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
entries: {@i Rage Alongside a Bestial Spirit}

Many Barbarians are in tune with the natural world, but few are as mystically intertwined with it as those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit. These Barbarians forge powerful connections with beasts and nature spirits, inspiring such ethereal beings to manifest and journey on far-flung adventures.

Barbarians who follow this path have a deep reverence for the cycle of the natural world. Such Barbarians are as likely to accept quests and pleas for aid from local wildlife as they are from people. This respect for animals and spirits doesn't cross into naivety—few understand the delicate balance between the needs of predator and prey better than those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal spirit that adopts the form of a beast and accompanies you on your adventures. Choose its stat block: {@creature Primal Guardian|GrimHollowPG24} or {@creature Primal Striker|GrimHollowPG24}. In addition, choose an environment that will modify the creature's stat block: Land, Sea, or Sky. You also determine the kind of animal it is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever companion you choose, it bears eldritch markings indicating its otherworldly origin.
The companion is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Beast in Combat
entries: In combat, the companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the companion acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Beast
entries: If the companion has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch it and expend a use of your Rage. The companion returns to life immediately with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can summon a different primal companion, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, the old one vanishes when the new one appears.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Rage
entries: While your Rage is active, your primal companion has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Kin to Beasts
entries: You always have the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Skinrider's Trance
entries: You take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to enter a trance and choose your primal companion or one Beast currently under the effect of your {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} spell within 60 feet of yourself. For the duration of this trance, you possess the chosen creature.

Once you possess a creature's body, you control it. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and senses are replaced by the creature's. You otherwise keep your game statistics. This possession ends if you choose to exit the trance (no action required by you), if the Beast you're possessing is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or if you and the Beast are on different planes of existence.

While in this trance, your body falls into a catatonic state. You can't move or take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}, and you're unaware of your surroundings. You can remain in the trance for a number of hours up to half your Barbarian level plus your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Shape of the Wild
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a new form for your primal companion, causing it to transform instantaneously. When you cause your primal companion to transform in this way, its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} change to its new {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
entries: {@i Channel the Rage of the Unquiet Dead}

Barbarians who walk the Path of the Wrathful Dead commune with the spirits of the deceased and channel their spectral powers. These Barbarians are often preoccupied with the dead whispering in their ears, which urge them to act upon the whims and emotions of the haunting spirits. Some who walk this path learn to master the powers gifted to them; others find they've become servants to the unending chorus clamoring for their attention.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of the Dead
entries: Your Rage taps into the endless fury of the unquiet dead. While your Rage is active, you take on aspects of restless spirits and you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadow Form
entries: You ignore {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. In addition, you can move through the space of any creature, but you can't end your move in an occupied space.

entries.name: Shadowy Sidestep
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

entries.name: Spectral Sight
entries: You see creatures and objects within 120 feet that have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

subclassFeature.name: Final Night Catharsis
entries: You are overcome by an emotion a nearby spirit experienced at its death. You gain one of the following options of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your choice.

entries.name: Hate
entries: When you miss with an attack roll against a creature, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll you make against it before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: When a creature you have {@condition Grappled|XPHB} is about to make an ability check to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition on itself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

entries.name: Terror
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Doom Revisited
entries: Once per active Rage, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to channel a traumatic death. When you do, choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Contamination
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Poison damage and gain the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

To determine the Poison damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. An affected creature can use an action to end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on itself.

entries.name: Hypothermia
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Cold damage and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} halved for 1 minute.
To determine the Cold damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. A creature can use an action to end this effect on itself.

entries.name: Immolation
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Fire damage.

To determine the Fire damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. As an action, a creature can extinguish the fire on itself by giving itself the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

subclassFeature.name: Death Is but a Door
entries: Your familiarity with death has left you resistant to its call. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}. In addition, you must fail four {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} to die instead of three as normal.

entries.name: Return the Spirit
entries: You can call the spirits of the deceased to restore life essence to a nearby creature. You can cast the {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB}, or {@spell Revivify|XPHB} spell without providing Material components. When you do, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level for {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels for {@spell Revivify|XPHB}, and 3 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels for {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this feature.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend two uses of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Powered by Pathos
entries: Your Rage is empowered by the overwhelming emotions of the unquiet dead. Your Final Night Catharsis feature grants an additional effect based on the chosen emotion.

entries.name: Hate
entries: While your Rage is active, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to summon spectral assailants to Grapple the creature. The creature makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failure, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition Grappled|XPHB}; however, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot for that creature until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Terror
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make that creature terrified until the start of its next turn. A terrified creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Adventurers
entries: {@i Be a Master of Classes}

Bards from the College of Adventurers learn from heroes of old and stories of legend. Bards are jacks of all trades, and, for the College of Adventurers, this statement rings even truer. They combine all the skills of their companions into one, allowing them to be versatile and supportive. While not having a direct goal, many adventurer-studying Bards live to tell tales of other heroes or seek to create their own. Stories of great deeds, of desperate cunning, of magical anomalies, or of godly might fuel these Bards.

subclassFeature.name: Talented Adventurer
entries: You learn an adventurer's talent of your choice from the {@filter "Adventurer's Talent Options"|optionalfeatures|feature type=ca:at} section later in this subclass's description. You learn an additional adventurer's talent of your choice when you reach Bard levels 6 and 14.

subclassFeature.name: Party Planner
entries: While a creature has a Bardic Inspiration die from you, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Help|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Well-Rounded
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, and you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Improvisational Talent
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose one adventurer's talent you know and replace it with one you don't.

subclassFeature.name: College of Fools
entries: {@i Laugh at Your Foes' Terror}

It's commonly believed the College of Fools is merely a front for a cult of Beleth. Bards in the College would say their relationship with the Arch Daemon of Fear is much more complicated. These Bards choose to laugh at Etharis's many horrors rather than be dismayed by them—a whimsical, if ghoulish, philosophy. Their delight in other creatures' terror encourages their obscene antics and cruel jests. One person's trick is another person's terror, after all.

subclassFeature.name: Antagonistic Antics
entries: You know the {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different Bard cantrip of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. Additionally, you always have the {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB} spell prepared.

In addition, when you take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Influence|XPHB} action on your turn, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on the same turn to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cruel Jest
entries: When a creature that you can see or hear within 30 feet of yourself fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration; roll your Bardic Inspiration die and deal Psychic damage equal to the number rolled plus your Charisma modifier. In addition, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gallows Humor
entries: When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or killed outright, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain an expended use of your Bardic Inspiration. When you do so, choose a creature within 30 feet of you that can hear and understand you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or gain the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. If the creature succeeds on the Wisdom saving throw, you regain the use of this ability. Otherwise, once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Last Laugh
entries: When you become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} or take damage while you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to regain all expended Bardic Inspiration dice and break out into a cackling fit of fatalistic glee at your own impending doom. For 1 minute, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage. Also, when a creature within 60 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, you can expend up to three Bardic Inspiration dice to force the attacker to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to the total rolled on the Bardic Inspiration dice plus your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Requiems
entries: {@i Sing the Songs of the Dead}

Performing macabre melodies filled with grief-stricken chords and mournful refrains, the College of Requiems stirs the very bones of the dead. Requiem Bards weave necromantic magic into their funerary songs to control and empower a host of Undead minions.

subclassFeature.name: Chilling Melody
entries: You learn two Necromancy cantrips of your choice. These count as Bard spells for you but don't count against the number of cantrips you know.

subclassFeature.name: Pluck the Heartstrings
entries: Your Bardic Inspiration can pluck at the tethers of life. Each creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can use it for one of the following effects.

entries.name: Defense
entries: When the creature is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die to be reduced to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die instead.

entries.name: Offense
entries: Immediately after the creature hits a target with an attack roll, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled as extra Necrotic damage dealt by the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Stir the Bones
entries: You always have the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell prepared. It counts as a Bard spell for you.

When you expend a use of Bardic Inspiration, choose Undead creatures under your control within 60 feet of yourself, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). The chosen creatures each gain a Bardic Inspiration die. These extra Bardic Inspiration dice do not count against your limit.

When an Undead creature under your control expends a Bardic Inspiration die on an attack roll, it can also add the number rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die to the attack's damage roll if that attack hits.

subclassFeature.name: Dual Death
entries: When you cast a Necromancy spell that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature within range.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Bardic Inspiration dice (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark Warrior
entries: {@i Provoke Your Enemies, Protect Your Allies}

Those who learn the fighting prowess of the Bulwark Warrior Warriors protect their allies from certain death. With endurance and strength as their primary skills, these warriors are prepared to take lethal strikes for their companions.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Taunt
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee attack using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can taunt it. Until the start of your next turn or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you. A creature can only be affected by one Taunt at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Weather the Storm
entries: You have grown accustomed to being battered and bruised. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you toughen up for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turns, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Fighter level plus your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Threatening Presence
entries: You can provoke your enemies into single-minded hatred of you. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, each creature of your choice that can hear you in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} Psychic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you. When you use this feature, you restore your use of Weather the Storm.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach Fighter level 15, you gain another use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aggressive Defense
entries: You know when to switch from defense to offense. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can lose {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to no more than half your Fighter level (round down) to deal extra damage to the target equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Second Wind
entries: Your endurance is unrivaled. When you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from Second Wind, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total.

subclassFeature.name: Halt the Assault
entries: When another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to change the target to yourself. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage against that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Nightwatcher
entries: {@i Take Back the Night}

Nightwatchers come from humble origins, often toiling as guards or investigators. Undaunted by dangers in the darkness, they stand firm against the growing night. Ever vigilant, they use the darkness to surprise and overwhelm foes much greater than themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Guardian
entries: Unraveling mysteries under the cover of night has honed your skills. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB}. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in that skill.

entries.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the following list: {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Perception|XPHB}, or {@skill Stealth|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Vigilant
entries: Your long nights of vigilance have left your senses attuned to signs of danger, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.

entries.name: Warning Shout
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to warn creatures of your choice within 30 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. Each creature can then take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll and move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Size Up
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you assess a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, when that creature makes an attack roll against you or another creature within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll and give {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Night Stalker
entries: You are adept at tracking down enemies in the dead of night, giving you these benefits.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet for 10 minutes. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you. While entirely within {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, your movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Ready for Action
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10. When you roll 18-20 on an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, you can take one additional action, except the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, on your first turn.
