subclassFeature.name: Beat Down
entries: Immediately after you miss a creature under the effect of your Size Up feature with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within range. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the new attack roll against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Leaden Crown
entries: {@i Harness the Will to Resist}

In contrast to the esoteric ideals of other orders, Warriors of the Leaden Crown have practical aims: the self-governance of all people. These Monks see history as a series of clashes between groups of powerful beings where Humanoids are at best collateral damage and at worst disposable pawns. To break this cycle of dependence and destruction, Warriors of the Leaden Crown master mental abilities to fight against the otherworldly powers of the multiverse and protect Humanoid sovereignty.

One component of this plan involves training to do battle with powerful planar foes. The other equally important component is ensuring that Humanoid societies are prepared to overthrow those already dominating them. To that end, these Monks seek political positions that place them in or near decision-making roles where they can influence others to fight back against Arch Seraphs, Arch Daemons, and Primordials.

subclassFeature.name: Subtle Hand
entries: Your martial arts are enhanced by a capacity for telekinetic strikes. During your turn, your reach is 5 feet greater with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. In addition, when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can choose to have it deal your choice of Psychic damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Prowess
entries: Your psychic powers have manifested in the ability to cast certain spells. You know the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|XPHB}.

In addition, you can cast certain spells by expending Focus Points. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 1 Focus Point to cast {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB}. You can also take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 2 Focus Points to cast {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Levitate|XPHB}, or {@spell Shatter|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you can cast them without Material components.

subclassFeature.name: Unsubtle Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or Monk weapon, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, you can move the target up to 10 feet toward or away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Crush
entries: Each time you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it gains a Pressure Point. A creature loses all Pressure Points if you cause a different creature to gain a Pressure Point or after 1 minute, whichever comes first. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Focus Point to telekinetically crush a creature with 1 or more of your Pressure Points. The creature loses all Pressure Points and must make a Strength saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage per Pressure Point, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Mastery
entries: After much training, you have mastered the psionic disciplines necessary to defend mortals from planar threats. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 5 Focus Points to cast {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Hold Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}, or {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you can cast them without Material components.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Pride
entries: {@i Prove Your Superiority}

Monks who become Warriors of Pride value themselves above all. These monks focus on mastering their form, ego, and their destructive power. They display monastic aesthetics publicly with the intention of gaining the respect and admiration of lesser beings.
The prideful traditions of this order include adorning themselves with jewelry, hiding their scars, and commanding respect from those who would oppose them.

subclassFeature.name: Tall Tales
entries: You have gained a knack for telling embellished tales of your past achievements. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bruised Ego
entries: Your ego strengthens you as you fight to prove your value. When you expend a Focus Point, you can also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB|Temporary Hit Point}). While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you gain twice that amount instead.

subclassFeature.name: Assertive Attacker
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} and Monk weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Irrational Retaliation
entries: {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} dealt to you is damage dealt to your pride, and that is something you simply can't allow. Whenever a creature deals damage to you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend 1 Focus Point. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Redoubled Efforts
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} while you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra damage dealt by the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Prideful
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can expend 1 Focus Point to enter a trance. While in this trance, you have the following effects:

items: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition.
You can't cast or concentrate on spells.
You suffer 1 {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure from damage from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead of 2.

entries: Whenever you start your turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, you must expend 1 Focus Point to maintain a trance, and you make {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Egotistical
entries: Injuries to your pride enrage you. You are considered {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} if your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are below your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Regret
entries: {@i Atone for Past Mistakes}
No one is born intent on bringing evil into this world, yet many lives are transformed by the suffering inflicted upon them. Warriors of Regret are haunted by the shadows of evil deeds done.

Through training and reflection, Warriors of Regret accept their past can't be erased. Instead, they focus on forging remorse and grief into a weapon against their foes. Though their misdeeds follow their every step, Warriors of Regret are not powerless to atone for them.

subclassFeature.name: Shade of Regret
entries: Once per turn, on your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point (no action required) to create a shade of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself. The shade is intangible and doesn't occupy its space. It lasts until the end of your next turn, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. While it persists, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shade Strike
entries: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can have the attacks originate from the shade instead of you. Attacks originating from the shade deal Necrotic or Force damage (your choice) rather than their normal damage type.

entries.name: Move
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the shade up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is within 60 feet of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: The Road Not Traveled
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, instead of moving, you can teleport yourself or an ally within 60 feet of you to the location of your shade.

subclassFeature.name: Aid Not Given
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Help|XPHB} action or touch a creature and restore a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature as though you were in the shade's space.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Guilt
entries: You can expend 3 Focus Points to release your pent-up guilt in a crushing wave that drops your foes to their knees. Creatures of your choice in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you or your shade must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Focus Point save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes Psychic damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Relive the Past
entries: Your Shade of Regret now lasts for 10 minutes. After using Flurry of Blows, your Shade can make one additional {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as per Shade Strike. You can also use the Stunning Strike feature through the Shade Strike.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Pestilence
entries: {@i Gain Strength Through Suffering}

Clad in grime-soaked armor and wielding rusting weapons, Oath of Pestilence Paladins spread corruption, disease, and filth. Bound by an oath that infests their bodies with all manner of plagues, these heralds of decay lumber forward with unholy toughness and grim resolve.
These Paladins share the following tenets:

items: Spread plague to foster strength in the survivors.
There is nothing unnatural or immoral about the ending of life.

subclassFeature.name: Debilitating Fever
entries: You can inflict disease upon a creature. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to give that creature the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target also has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target makes a Constitution save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Entropic Infection
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity and select a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. For 1 minute, if you deal damage to the target, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage. In addition, the target loses {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. The target can make a Constitution save against the Paladin's spell save DC at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Pestilence Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Pestilence Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Pestilence Spells
rows: {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow|XPHB|Acid Arrow}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Rampant Sickness
entries: You emit an aura of contagion and virulence. When a creature within your Aura of Protection is about to make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Disgusting Resilience
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can spend any number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice}, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled on those dice.

In addition, if you are killed, your corpse explodes in a shower of pus and gore. Each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you makes Constitution saving throw gainst the Paladin's spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Plaguebringer
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes, or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: One with Plague
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bolstered by Rot
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can't be reduced.

entries.name: Entropic Radiance
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn within your Aura of Protection, it takes Necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Slaughter
entries: {@i Revel in Unbridled Violence}

The only truth of war is death. The only virtue is to kill. The only victory is to survive. Heroism, honor, and glory are illusions. This is the creed of Tormach, Arch Daemon of Wrath, but this philosophy rings true for all warriors who devote themselves, body and soul, to the thrill of combat and the delight of bloodshed. Such champions find themselves at the forefront of armies, using the most violent methods at their disposal to bring battles to a swift close... or drawing out the war to sate their own appetites.
Paladins who take the Oath of Slaughter share the following tenets:

items: Violence is the end, not the means.
Break the body to break the spirit.
Revel in bloodshed, whether friend or foe.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzied Slaughter
entries: You can harness the rush of battle to drive you to even greater acts of violence. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to enter a battle frenzy. You gain the following benefits while this feature is active.

entries.name: Reflexive Attack
entries: When you miss with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make another attack with the same weapon.

entries.name: Condition Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Frenzied Slaughter lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. If your Frenzied Slaughter is still active on your next turn, you can extend it for another round by doing one of the following:

items: Make an attack roll against an enemy.
Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
You are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} at the end of your turn.

entries: Each time Frenzied Slaughter is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain it for up to 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Slaughter Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Slaughter Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodthirst Aura
entries: Your lust for blood infects those around you. When a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} ally within your Aura of Protection makes an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it gains a bonus to damage. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier.

Additionally, when a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature within your Aura of Protection makes a saving throw against a Sangromancy spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the save.

subclassFeature.name: Follow Through
entries: When a creature in your Aura of Protection becomes {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make an attack with a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll

subclassFeature.name: Blood Knight
entries: Your bloodthirst imbues you with preternatural strength and resilience, allowing you to keep sowing slaughter. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Crimson Armor
entries: When a creature within your Aura of Protection becomes {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} by an enemy, you gain 30 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Seeing Red
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one melee attack against that creature, using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Wanton Slaughter
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can choose any number of creatures within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. Each chosen creature takes Force damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Zeal
entries: {@i Eliminate Threats to Ideological Purity}

The Oath of Zeal is taken by paladins consumed by hatred for a specific group or ideology. Zealots, as these Paladins are sometimes called, pursue an inquisition against their enemies at all costs. They abandon compassion and honor as impediments to the more important work of ridding the world of those they deem dangerous or heretical.
These Paladins share the following tenets:

items: Reveal heresy and destroy those who practice it.
Show unwavering conviction and unflinching resolve.
Perform any sacrifice necessary to stop wickedness.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of the Heretic
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to mark a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself as a heretic.

For 1 minute, your weapon attacks and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against the chosen creature can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. In addition, whenever the target starts its turn, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within reach.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Zeal Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Zeal Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Zeal Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Clarity
entries: You and your allies have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a {@condition Blinded|XPHB} ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there. Additionally, you can see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures within your Aura of Protection.

subclassFeature.name: Compel Confession
entries: You can cast {@spell Zone of Truth|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. In addition, a creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns while in your Zone of Truth until it chooses to fail its saving throw instead.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalyptic Revelation
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can reveal the true nature of your enemies for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required). You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blinding Glory
entries: Enemies that start their turn within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against the Paladin's spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: See the Truth
entries: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Smite the Heretic
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a creature within 60 feet of yourself and reveal its weaknesses. You and your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Blood
entries: {@i Wreak Bloody Havoc}

The Circle of Blood is a keeper of the old ways. They remember how ancient Druids performed sacrificial rituals under a blood-red moon to appease the uncaring forces of nature. These Druids trade blood for life in a delicate balance to bolster their allies and destroy their enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Blood Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Blood Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of Blood Spells
rows: {@spell Blood Rush|GrimHollowPG24}, {@spell Crimson Lash|GrimHollowPG24}, {@spell Sense Lifeblood|GrimHollowPG24}

subclassFeature.name: Rite of the Blood Moon
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to adopt the violent savagery of the Blood Moon for 10 minutes. During this time, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Red Resilience
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times your Druid level.

items.name: Speed Increased
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Violent Strikes
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Boon
entries: Whenever a creature you can see within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to claim the last vestiges of its vitality. You regain 1 spent {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} and grant a creature you can see within 60 feet of you {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Druid level.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Lust
entries: While your Blood Moon is active, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Improved Violent Strikes
entries: The extra Necrotic damage from your Violent Strikes increases to {@dice 2d6}.

items.name: Red Rage
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Exsanguinate
entries: When you use your Blood Boon, you regain spent {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} equal to half your Druid level and give {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Druid level to a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one creature) that you can see within 60 feet of yourself.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Entropy
entries: {@i Become an Instrument of Decay and Ruin}

Druids of the Circle of Entropy see doom as a constant of the natural world. Lives end, works erode, and the civilizations of Etharis ultimately come to ruin. The inevitable end of the old brings opportunity for the new. These fatalistic Druids see themselves as agents of ruin, ending those whose time has passed to make space for those whose time has yet to come.

subclassFeature.name: Catastrophic Power
entries: You have mastered talents, both magical and martial, in your pursuit of the inevitable destruction of mortals and their works. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain one of the following benefits until you finish your next {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Elemental Cataclysm
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a spell slot to cause elemental energy to burst in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 60 feet of yourself. Choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning.

Each creature in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type per level of the spell slot expended, and then has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to that damage type for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} on a success.

entries.name: Ruinous Smite
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage with an attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage, plus another {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot.

entries.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your supernatural connection to destruction allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of weapon of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Shortbow|XPHB|Shortbows} or {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB|Quarterstaffs}.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kind of weapon you choose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery property of {@item Sling|XPHB|Slings} or {@item Greatclub|XPHB|Greatclubs}.

subclassFeature.name: Ruin Incarnate
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to adopt an aspect of entropy and the inevitable end of all things for 10 minutes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: All Things Pass
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creatures.

entries.name: Inexorable Onslaught
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

entries.name: Ironskin Armor
entries: Your base AC becomes 17 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) if your AC is lower than that.

subclassFeature.name: Many Roads to Ruin
entries: Your mystic connection to catastrophe and destruction grows stronger. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Elemental Assault
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, whenever you hit with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can cause it to deal your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Necrotic damage rather than its normal damage type.

entries.name: Increased Might
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, you can add your Wisdom modifier (minimum bonus of +1) to your Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Shake the Earth
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can strike the earth with a thunderous tremor and grow. When you do so, your size increases by one category (from Medium to Large, for example) for 10 minutes. In addition, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from your new form must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. The tremor deals Bludgeoning damage to each structure in contact with the ground in the area. To determine this damage, roll a number of d10s equal to your Druid level, and add them together.
While your size is increased by this feature, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on a hit.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Entropy's Apex
entries: You have mastered the ability to hasten the inevitable slide toward entropy. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Ruinous Smite
entries: Until the end of your next turn, any creature affected by your Ruinous Smite suffers a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19-20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Improved Inexorable Onslaught
entries: While your Ruin Incarnate feature is active, you can attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} three times instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

entries.name: World Breaker
entries: You regain your use of your Shake the Earth feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Domain
entries: {@i Wield the Power that Killed the Gods}

Even the most benevolent divine beings operate outside the bounds of mortal comprehension. These eldritch forces sing a siren song that calls to mortal worshippers through lucid dreams and terrible whispers. The Eldritch Domain empowers the followers of the unknown and distant forces of chaos, divine entities of eldritch oblivion, and dead gods.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Eldritch Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Eldritch Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Contagion
entries: You've been gifted with the ability to impart a fleeting taste of the unknowable on others. When you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast a spell using a spell slot that targets one or more creatures, you can force one target of the original spell to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, roll on the Eldritch Effects table, and the target creature suffers that effect for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. This effect ends early if you use this feature again.

entries.caption: Eldritch Effects
rows: The creature can't speak or cast spells that have Verbal components.
The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.
The creature is disoriented. If it uses more than 5 feet of its movement to do anything other than stand, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The creature is distracted by visions and voices and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.

The creature is unsure of itself. On its turns, it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the {@action Attack|XPHB} action.
The creature is reckless. It has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, but attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
The creature has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition and can't see anything more than 30 feet away.
The creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Prophecy of Doom
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you expend a use of your Channel Divinity to choose a point within 120 feet of you that you can see and roll on the Eldritch Effects table. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer the rolled effect for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Calm
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

Additionally, your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. The attempt automatically fails, and the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take Psychic damage equal to your Cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Sing the Song that Ends the World
entries: When a creature fails a Wisdom saving throw against your Prophecy of Doom feature, you can deal {@damage 10d10} Psychic damage to it. Once a creature takes damage in this way, it is immune to this effect for 10 minutes, after which it can be affected again.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisition Domain
entries: {@i Cleanse the Heretics}
The Inquisition Domain reflects the order of the multiverse and the rejection of tainted magic—so far as certain celestial powers see it. Only the divine casters are pure and fit for use.

Since arcane magic is strong enough to challenge the gods, divine beings of this domain, such as the Arch Seraph Empyreus, demand magic-using mortals be kept in check. Most zealots root out all arcanists, while some strike fragile truces when complete removal isn't feasible.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisition Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Inquisition Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Witch Hunter's Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Force damage to the target. If the creature is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell, you deal an extra {@damage 2d8} Force damage instead. At Cleric level 14, the extra Force damage increases to {@dice 2d8}, or {@dice 3d8} if the creature is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell.

If a creature fails its saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} as a result of taking damage from this feature, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the extra Force damage dealt.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Shield
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to bestow a temporary resilience against arcane harm for 10 minutes. Choose a creature you can see (including yourself) within 30 feet of yourself. The chosen creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Cleric level. While a creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by your Spell Shield, the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells, and it has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage of spells. If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain when Spell Shield ends, they vanish.

subclassFeature.name: Rebuke Invoker
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} in response to a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast a spell, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage, plus another {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot the creature expended. Cantrips are considered level 1 spells for this ability. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage instead.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Supernal Safeguard
entries: Spell Shield can target a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one creature).

subclassFeature.name: Purification Domain
entries: {@i Purge Sickness with Suffering}

The Purification Domain believes sickness, mutation, and other forms of bodily corruption are signs of a corresponding spiritual malady. Virtue can't exist alongside impurity. The wickedness of humanity and other mortal, sentient creatures is a contagion that manifests plagues such as the Weeping Pox. When there's a risk of such corruption spreading, there's only one surefire way to contain the rot and atone for the sins that led to this point: Burn it out.

subclassFeature.name: Cleanse with Fire
entries: When you deal damage with a cantrip or an attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d8} Fire damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Purification Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Purification Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Purification Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|XPHB}, {@spell Flame Blade|XPHB}
{@spell Aura of Purity|XPHB}, {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Unclean Brand
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, instead of dealing the strike's normal damage, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to sear a symbol into the creature's flesh, marking it with a glowing brand for 1 minute. During that time, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws against your spells. Additionally, the creature gains {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Fire damage you deal, even if it normally has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Ward Against Corruption
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end diseases and against any effect that would change your form, such as the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch a willing creature to grant this benefit, but the creature takes Fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}. Once you grant this benefit, it lasts for 1 hour or until you grant this benefit again.

subclassFeature.name: Sear Imperfections
entries: You can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} and {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} on a willing creature without expending spell slots and without Material components, but the target takes {@damage 1d6} Fire damage for each level of the spell slot immediately after you cast it. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalypse Sorcery
entries: {@i Hasten or Stall the End of the World}
Apocalypse Sorcerers have seen the shape of things to come. They may have visions of the Great Beast ushering in the end of Etharis or dreams of Gormadraug waking and devouring the land.

These prophecies besiege Apocalypse Sorcerers, plaguing and empowering in equal measure. Some find relief in putting these revelations into writing, producing texts that read as incoherent but slowly seep into the mind as sensible, even inevitable. When the apocalypse-bringer is freed to travel across Etharis unburdened, undoing the works of gods and men, magic will swell and pool, ripe for the taking. This sign of the end is also their gift.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalyptic Spells
entries: When you reach a sorcerer level specified in the Apocalyptic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Apocalyptic Spells
rows: {@spell Augury|XPHB}, {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB}, {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Unhinged Asservations
entries: You are obsessed with documenting your visions. You gain proficiency with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} and you can create {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG|Spell Scrolls} in half the time and at half the cost in GP.

In addition, when you create a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG}, you can ensorcell it. When you ensorcell a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG}, you must expend a spell slot equal to or greater than the spell's level and you can spend Sorcery Points to apply one of your Metamagic options. Any creature that knows at least one language can use your ensorcelled {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG}, which casts the spell with the benefit of the Metamagic option you chose. The {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} remains ensorcelled until it is used or you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bear Witness
entries: You have prepared your entire life for the end of the world. While your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Apocalyptic Inurement
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Force damage.

entries.name: Recite Scripture
entries: Once per active Innate Sorcery, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can use a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} that has a spell with a casting time of {@variantrule Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unflappable
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Apocrypha
entries: Your obsessive reflections on the end of existence inspire your writing. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can create one {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} at no cost. It must be a spell of level 5 or lower that you can cast. This {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} disintegrates when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Magic
entries: The end of Etharis is a time when magic is unbound and magical powers long hidden are unearthed. When you cast a Sorcerer spell using a spell slot, you can choose one option below.

entries.name: Excessive
entries: If the spell requires a Material component with a cost, you can cast the spell without the Material component. You take Force damage equal to four times the level of the spell slot immediately after you cast it. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}

entries.name: Inexorable
entries: Taking damage can't break your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the spell. When the spell ends, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

entries.name: Pyrrhic
entries: If the spell requires an attack roll, the spell automatically hits and the attack roll is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by an amount equal to four times the level of the spell slot immediately after you cast it. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum returns to normal.

subclassFeature.name: The End is Nigh
entries: You loudly proclaim what will come to pass when the world ends. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you describe the end of days. When you do so, each creature of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage and {@damage 6d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition on a successful save. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature can be revived only by a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend 6 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted Sorcery
entries: {@i Commune with the Dead}

Unlike other Sorcerers, the circumstances of your birth were mundane and you have no arcane inheritance passed down from strange ancestors. Instead, you gained your sorcerous powers after you survived an experience that left you near death. Since that experience, you've had a preternatural sense for danger and a ghostly companion that either can't, or won't, leave you alone. Some Haunted, as Sorcerers who share your origin are called, develop cordial relationships with their phantom, while others find their spectral companion to be a relentless nuisance.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted Spells
entries: When you reach a sorcerer level specified in the Haunted Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Haunted Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can add your Charisma modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Companion
entries: You learn the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell and can cast it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action without expending a spell slot.

The familiar takes the form of a {@creature Specter|XMM}, though it is an Undead instead of a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can command your phantom companion to gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until it attacks or you cast a spell through it. While {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage and can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment or objects it is holding remains visible.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to make its Life Drain attack with its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of Spirit
entries: Your bond with your phantom companion empowers it. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your familiar's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by four times your Sorcerer level.
You can cast spells as if you were in the familiar's space.
When you use your action to cast a spell, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command your phantom companion to use its Life Drain attack with its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Deathly Pallor
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and when you cast a Sorcerer spell that deals damage, it can deal your choice of Necrotic damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Possession
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can direct your phantom companion to possess a creature of your choice within 5 feet of your phantom. The target makes a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, your phantom companion enters the target's body for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target resists the efforts to possess it, and your familiar can't possess it again for 24 hours.

Once the phantom companion possesses a creature's body, it controls that creature. The familiar's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and senses are replaced by the creature's. The phantom companion otherwise keeps its game statistics.

While the target is possessed, you have a telepathic link with your phantom companion as long as the two of you are within 100 feet. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to your phantom companion (no action required) unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Your phantom companion does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, the phantom companion acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.
You can command the target to take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} but must take your own {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to do so.
Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the possession on itself on a success, and your phantom companion reappears in the closest unoccupied space.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Become Death
entries: You can transmute your physical form into a spectral one when near death. When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. At the start of each of your turns, you lose 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} and creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you take 10 Necrotic damage. While you have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this feature, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage, a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet, can {@variantrule Hover|XPHB}, and you can move through occupied spaces as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn in such a space, you are shunted to the last unoccupied space you were in.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Wretched Bloodline Sorcery
entries: {@i Wield Your Curse Like a Weapon}

With every promise whispered to a fairy, every contract signed with a devil, and every pact made with the dead, there's a chance someone doesn't keep their end of the bargain. The vengeance of immortal beings lasts much longer than one lifetime, and the lingering magic of these curses can affect the mortal's descendants.

These inherited magical afflictions may manifest as a plague, deformity, or aversion to the sun. In such families, children may be born who learn to master the latent magic within their inherited curses, turning their banes into personal boonsthese sorcerers are known collectively as the Wretched.

subclassFeature.name: Bad Luck Charm
entries: You have the ability to cast a sliver of your curse onto another temporarily. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. The chosen creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the start of your next turn.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend 1 Sorcery Point (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Ties
entries: Your senses easily attune to the supernatural forces that caused your inherited affliction. You always have the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it without expending a spell slot.

In addition, choose one of the following types of creatures as the being that cursed your ancestor: Fey, Fiend, or Undead. On each of your turns while you maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB}, including the turn when you cast it, creatures of the chosen type have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against you, and you can't be possessed, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} by such creatures.
Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Wretched Curse
entries: You suffer from a curse inherited from an ancestor who failed to uphold their end of a bargain with an otherworldly power. Choose one of the following curses that was passed down to you.

entries.name: Hulking
entries: Your ancestor was cursed with a hulking frame. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks to escape notice by moving quietly. In addition, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 whenever you gain another Sorcerer level. Finally, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Nocturnal
entries: Your ancestor was cursed to shun the light of day. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight while you are in sunlight. In addition, you can see normally in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}—both magical and nonmagical—within 120 feet of yourself.

entries.name: Plaguebearer
entries: Your ancestor was cursed with physical symptoms of a plague. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) checks made to influence an {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} Humanoid within 5 feet of yourself. In addition, you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition and have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Share the Burden
entries: You always have the {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast the spell by spending 3 Sorcery Points instead of a spell slot. When you cast the spell in this way, the spell doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and its range changes to 60 feet for that casting.

subclassFeature.name: Terrifying Visage
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can adopt the terrifying visage of the being that cursed your ancestor for 10 minutes. During this time, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cause creatures of your choice you can see you within 30 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. In addition, while your Terrifying Visage feature is active, you gain the following benefit based on the creature type chosen with your Blood Ties feature.

entries.name: Fey
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold and Fire damage.

entries.name: Undead
entries: When you take damage of any type other than Radiant, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage by half your Sorcerer level.
Once you use Terrifying Visage, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Summons
entries: Your magic has become powerful enough that you can call and command a servant of those who cursed you. Choose one of the following creatures based on the choice you made with your Blood Ties feature: {@creature Lamia|XMM} or {@creature Troll|XMM} (Fey only), {@creature Barbed Devil|XMM}, {@creature Incubus|XMM}, or {@creature Succubus|XMM} (Fiend only), {@creature Ghost|XMM} or {@creature Wraith|XMM} (Undead only).

You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and spend 5 Sorcery Points to summon your chosen creature. The creature appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet. It disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you use this feature to summon another creature, or after 10 minutes have passed.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

subclassFeature.name: The Coven
entries: {@i Curse and Befuddle with Hag Magic}

Hags dwell in the deep places of Etharis, from the primordial forests of Valika to the putrid streets of Liesecht. These creatures, though rarely benevolent, are willing to bargain with mortals in exchange for furthering their own capricious goals.

Warlocks often find themselves with a single Hag as a sponsor. Should this Hag have a coven, it can lead to the peculiar situation of Warlock agents acting against other Hags or their Warlocks within the coven. But such is the politics of the Realm of Faerie.

subclassFeature.name: Coven Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Coven Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven Spells
rows: {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Identify|XPHB}, {@spell Locate Object|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Hag's Eye
entries: As an agent of a Hag, you have been gifted with a magical item known as a Hag's Eye. Crafted from a real eye and fitted into a ring, pendant, or other accessory, this item can be used as an Arcane Focus for your Warlock spells. The Hag can see through the eye, and the destruction of the item can cause the Hag actual pain, so any pawn who loses this talisman often invokes the Hag's ire.

While you possess the eye, you can cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once) without expending a spell slot, and you regain all expended uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. In addition, when you reach Warlock level 10, you can use the eye to cast {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so once you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hag's Guile
entries: Hags delight in deceiving and manipulating others, and you gain some of their skill in doing so. You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different Warlock cantrip of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

Additionally, if a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine an illusion you have created, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the check.

Also, the first time a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine an illusion spell you have cast and succeeds on the Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check, you can cause the illusion to deal Psychic damage. The damage equals {@dice 1d6 plus 1d6} for each spell slot used to cast the spell.

You can do damage a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hag's Visage
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you twist your face into a horrifying mask resembling your Hag patron. It lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. While this effect lasts, you gain the benefits listed below.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Horrifying Gaze
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one Humanoid that you can see and that can see you within 30 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that can see you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on this save.

entries.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one Humanoid that you can see and that can see you within 30 feet of you that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition.

On a successful save, the creature takes Necrotic damage equal to your Warlock level, it is no longer {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and it can't be targeted by your Hag's Visage again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Death Gaze
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one Humanoid that you can see and that can see you within 30 feet of you that has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against your spell save DC or be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

On a successful save, the creature takes Necrotic damage equal to twice your Warlock level, it is no longer {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, and it can't be targeted by your Hag's Visage again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hag's Craft
entries: The Hag imparts the knowledge to craft two magic items. You can temporarily turn a normal vessel into a Hag's Cauldron by expending a spell slot. This magical cauldron lasts for 10 minutes. During that time, you can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} to pour out three Common, two Uncommon, or one Rare potion. The potions lose efficacy at the end of your next {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You regain this ability at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Additionally, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can expend a spell slot and imbue a gemstone worth at least 10 GP with magic, turning it into a Minor Heartstone. This magic item grants the bearer {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition and the ability to cast {@spell Blink|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot. The magic within the gemstone fades after 24 hours and the gem crumbles into dust.

subclassFeature.name: The First Vampire Patron
entries: {@i Wield the Power of Undeath}

You have made a pact with a powerful vampire cursed by the gods or born as a creature of the night. Hundreds of haunted beings serve this vampire, so why enter a pact with you? Because you can act in the light of day unhindered? To cull weaker vampires?

subclassFeature.name: Drain Life
entries: You gain an innate power to drain life from the living. After you take the Attack or {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. On a hit, the {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} deals Necrotic damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier instead of its normal damage.

When you hit a creature with Drain Life, you can expend a Pact Magic spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage to the target, plus another {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot. When you expend a spell slot in this way, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Predator
entries: As a predator of the night, you have been blessed with enhanced vision in darkness. You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: First Vampire Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the First Vampire Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: First Vampire Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}
{@spell Conjure Animals|XPHB} (bats, rats, or wolves only), {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Creature of the Night
entries: You always have the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell prepared. With this feature, you can cast it only on yourself without expending a spell slot and without Material components to transform into a {@creature Bat|XMM}, {@creature Rat|XMM}, or {@creature Wolf|XMM}.

Your game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but you retain your creature type; {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; class features; languages; and feats. You also retain your skill and saving throw proficiencies and use your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} for them, in addition to gaining the proficiencies of the creature. If a skill or saving throw modifier in the Beast's stat block is higher than yours, use the one in the stat block.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Appetite
entries: When you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with your Drain Life feature, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to consume the last of its fleeting mortality. When you do so, you regain one of your expended Pact Magic spell slots.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Night
entries: Your vampire patron grants you a taste of true immortality. You no longer age, and you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you regain {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and you aren't in direct sunlight or running water. If you take Radiant damage, you don't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from this feature at the start of your next turn.
When you use your Drain Life feature, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage without expending a spell slot.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: The Parasite Patron
entries: {@i Become One with a Cosmic Being}

Your patron is a cosmic parasite, draining the vitality of entire peoples and worlds. Upon forging a pact with such a patron, you become host to one of its nascent offspring. As you grow in power, the boundary between your identity and the parasitic larva within blurs.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Siphon
entries: Your patron has taught you to siphon magic from your enemies and make it your own. Immediately after a creature you can see within 60 feet of you casts a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. The DC equals your spell save DC. On a failed save, that creature can't cast a spell again until 8 hours have passed. While this effect lasts, if the spell was at least level 1 and of a level you can cast, you have that spell prepared.

The maximum number of spell levels you can have siphoned at once equals 1 plus your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or die, you lose all siphoned spells. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you lose all siphoned spells.

subclassFeature.name: Physical Specimen
entries: Your patron has enhanced your physical form to improve your utility as a host and pawn. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose a number of the following benefits up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one) that lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose one of your selected benefits and replace it with another from this list.

items: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an amount equal to your Warlock level.
You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 60 feet.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.
Your jump distance is tripled, and you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
Add your Charisma modifier to your Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Sentinel
entries: Your patron remains alert to threats to its host at all times. You can't be {@status surprised|XPHB} and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Spawn Pawn
entries: You always have the {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} spell prepared. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
In addition, taking damage can't break your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on Dominate Person. When a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it takes Psychic damage equal to your Warlock level.

subclassFeature.name: Larval Regeneration
entries: When you die, a larval parasite bursts from your corpse. You control the parasite. The parasite uses the {@creature Rat|XMM} stat block except it has your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; class features; languages; and feats. It can't cast spells. In addition, it has the following ability:

entries.name: Burrowing Possession
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, the parasite can cause a Humanoid within 5 feet of it to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (your choice) against your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, the parasite burrows into the creature, dealing Piercing damage equal to your Warlock level. While burrowed inside a creature, the parasite can't take any action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}, and has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage except Psychic damage.

On each of the creature's subsequent turns, it can use its action to make a Constitution saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. If the creature succeeds, the parasite is ejected from its body and into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice within 5 feet of it. If the parasite is burrowed inside the creature when the creature's turn ends, the creature takes Necrotic damage equal to twice your Warlock level. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it immediately dies, the parasite disappears, and you take over the body of the Humanoid as if you had been targeted by the {@spell Reincarnate|XPHB} spell and rolled the species the Humanoid had been.
If you are returned to life, such as by the {@spell Revivify|XPHB} spell, your parasite immediately disappears.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Plague Doctor
entries: {@i Plague Your Enemies with Magical Concoctions}

Blending spellcasting with science, you distill your magic into concoctions that harm or heal. Plague Doctors often wear grotesque masks protecting them from their toxic ingredients. Many fearfully regard the mask as a sign of pestilence, making Plague Doctors a source of both hope and trepidation.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Craft
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill and proficiency with the {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB} and {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}.
Additionally, you have learned to create magical potions.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: With 10 minutes of work or when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can prepare magical potions if you have an {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB} or {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}. When you do so, you must expend a level 1+ spell slot for each potion you create and choose a spell from your spellbook that targets only one creature. The chosen spell must be of an equal or lower level than the expended spell slot.

entries.name: Consuming
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can drink the potion or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of it. When a creature consumes the potion, it becomes the target of the spell as if you had cast it. If the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the creature that consumes the potion Concentrates on it.
Unconsumed potions last until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Good Medicine
entries: When you craft a potion, you can choose to expend a spell slot without choosing a spell to craft a dose of Good Medicine. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can drink the dose or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. When Good Medicine is consumed, roll a number of d8s equal to the level of the spell slot expended, and the target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total. If you expended a level 3+ spell slot on this feature, Good Medicine also removes the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Bad Medicine
entries: When you craft a potion, you can choose to expend a spell slot without choosing a spell to craft a dose of Bad Medicine. When you create a dose, choose one effect per level of the spell slot expended.

items: The creature has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.
The creature takes an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage the first time it takes damage each turn.
The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Poison damage each time it takes an action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.
The creature takes Acid damage equal to the level of the spell slot expended at the start of each of its turns.

entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can hurl a dose of Bad Medicine at a point you can see within 30 feet. Creatures within 10 feet of that point must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target suffers one of the chosen effects for 1 minute. On each of its turns, the target can take an action and repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Breathe It In
entries: Being persistently exposed to the deadliest ailments known has given you some small measure of resistance. After you take Necrotic or Poison damage, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage taken. In addition, you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Medicinal Master
entries: When Good Medicine restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, that creature regains {@dice 2d8} additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
When Bad Medicine deals Acid damage to a creature, that creature takes {@dice 2d8} extra Acid damage. Additionally, target creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on their saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Sangromancer
entries: {@i Spill Blood for Power}

You study an uncommon school of magic known as Sangromancy or blood magic. Despite its dark reputation, there's nothing inherently evil about the practice of Sangromancy, though its demands on its practitioners are gruesome. As a Sangromancer, your chosen magic demands more than knowledge: it demands sacrifice. Other Wizards may view you with skepticism or even outright hostility, but none can deny the potency of your art.

subclassFeature.name: Sangromancy Savant
entries: {@filter Sangromancy spells|spells|source=grimhollowpg24|subschool=sangromancy} count as Wizard spells for you. Choose two Sangromancy spells, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one Sangromancy spell to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Full-Blooded
entries: You draw magic from blood. It is represented by your Sangromancy Dice, which fuel powers you have from this subclass. You have a pool of d12s that you can expend instead of a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Die} when you cast Sangromancy spells. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 plus your Wizard level. You regain one expended Sangromancy Die when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended Sangromancy Dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Vigor
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 6, and it increases by 1 whenever you gain another Wizard level. In addition, whenever you cast a Sangromancy spell with a spell slot, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the level of the spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Blood for Blood
entries: Once on each of your turns when you deal damage to one or more creatures with a Wizard spell you cast, you can spend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} or a Sangromancy Die, roll the die, and deal extra damage to one of those creatures equal to the roll. If the creature is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can roll twice and use the higher of the two rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Red Renewal
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you regain expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and Sangromancy Dice equal to half your Wizard level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Daemonologist
entries: {@i Steal Scraps of Divine and Infernal Power}

Through theological study, or perhaps an induction into a secretive cabal, Daemonologists have learned to cast divine magic without the need for faith or bargains. Their spellbooks are scribed with prayer fragments and blasphemous hymns, enabling them to siphon scraps of power from both Arch Seraphs and Arch Daemons.
